2636 fw_state = instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg(instance->reg_set) & MFI_STATE_MASK;
2637
2638 if ((!outstanding && (fw_state == MFI_STATE_OPERATIONAL)))
2639 goto no_outstanding;
2640
2641 if (instance->disableOnlineCtrlReset)
2642 goto kill_hba_and_failed;
2643 do {
2644 if ((fw_state == MFI_STATE_FAULT) || atomic_read(&instance->fw_outstanding)) {
2645 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
2646 "%s:%d waiting_for_outstanding: before issue OCR. FW state = 0x%x, oustanding 0x%x\n",
2647 __func__, __LINE__, fw_state, atomic_read(&instance->fw_outstanding));
2648 if (i == 3)
2649 goto kill_hba_and_failed;
2650 megasas_do_ocr(instance);
2651
2652 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_HW_CRITICAL_ERROR) {
2653 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "%s:%d OCR failed and HBA is killed.\n",
2654 __func__, __LINE__);
2655 return FAILED;
2656 }
2657 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "%s:%d waiting_for_outstanding: after issue OCR.\n",
2658 __func__, __LINE__);
2659
2660 for (sl = 0; sl < 10; sl++)
2661 msleep(500);
2662
2663 outstanding = atomic_read(&instance->fw_outstanding);
2664
2665 fw_state = instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg(instance->reg_set) & MFI_STATE_MASK;
2666 if ((!outstanding && (fw_state == MFI_STATE_OPERATIONAL)))
2667 goto no_outstanding;
2668 }
2669 i++;
2670 } while (i <= 3);
2671
2672no_outstanding:
2673
2674 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "%s:%d no more pending commands remain after reset handling.\n",
2675 __func__, __LINE__);
2676 return SUCCESS;
2677
2678kill_hba_and_failed:
2679
2680 /* Reset not supported, kill adapter */
2681 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "%s:%d killing adapter scsi%d"
2682 " disableOnlineCtrlReset %d fw_outstanding %d \n",
2683 __func__, __LINE__, instance->host->host_no, instance->disableOnlineCtrlReset,
2684 atomic_read(&instance->fw_outstanding));
2685 megasas_dump_pending_frames(instance);
2686 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
2687
2688 return FAILED;
2689}
2690
2691/**
2692 * megasas_generic_reset - Generic reset routine
2693 * @scmd: Mid-layer SCSI command
2694 *
2695 * This routine implements a generic reset handler for device, bus and host
2696 * reset requests. Device, bus and host specific reset handlers can use this
2697 * function after they do their specific tasks.
2698 */
2699static int megasas_generic_reset(struct scsi_cmnd *scmd)
2700{
2701 int ret_val;
2702 struct megasas_instance *instance;
2703
2704 instance = (struct megasas_instance *)scmd->device->host->hostdata;
2705
2706 scmd_printk(KERN_NOTICE, scmd, "megasas: RESET cmd=%x retries=%x\n",
2707 scmd->cmnd[0], scmd->retries);
2708
2709 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_HW_CRITICAL_ERROR) {
2710 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "cannot recover from previous reset failures\n");
2711 return FAILED;
2712 }
2713
2714 ret_val = megasas_wait_for_outstanding(instance);
2715 if (ret_val == SUCCESS)
2716 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "reset successful\n");
2717 else
2718 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "failed to do reset\n");
2719
2720 return ret_val;
2721}
2722
2723/**
2724 * megasas_reset_timer - quiesce the adapter if required
2725 * @scmd: scsi cmnd
2726 *
2727 * Sets the FW busy flag and reduces the host->can_queue if the
2728 * cmd has not been completed within the timeout period.
2729 */
2730static enum
2731blk_eh_timer_return megasas_reset_timer(struct scsi_cmnd *scmd)
2732{
2733 struct megasas_instance *instance;
2734 unsigned long flags;
2735
2736 if (time_after(jiffies, scmd->jiffies_at_alloc +
2737 (scmd_timeout * 2) * HZ)) {
2738 return BLK_EH_NOT_HANDLED;
2739 }
2740
2741 instance = (struct megasas_instance *)scmd->device->host->hostdata;
2742 if (!(instance->flag & MEGASAS_FW_BUSY)) {
2743 /* FW is busy, throttle IO */
2744 spin_lock_irqsave(instance->host->host_lock, flags);
2745
2746 instance->host->can_queue = instance->throttlequeuedepth;
2747 instance->last_time = jiffies;
2748 instance->flag |= MEGASAS_FW_BUSY;
2749
2750 spin_unlock_irqrestore(instance->host->host_lock, flags);
2751 }
2752 return BLK_EH_RESET_TIMER;
2753}
2754
2755/**
2756 * megasas_dump_frame - This function will dump MPT/MFI frame
2757 */
2758static inline void
2759megasas_dump_frame(void *mpi_request, int sz)
2760{
2761 int i;
2762 __le32 *mfp = (__le32 *)mpi_request;
2763
2764 printk(KERN_INFO "IO request frame:\n\t");
2765 for (i = 0; i < sz / sizeof(__le32); i++) {
2766 if (i && ((i % 8) == 0))
2767 printk("\n\t");
2768 printk("%08x ", le32_to_cpu(mfp[i]));
2769 }
2770 printk("\n");
2771}
2772
2773/**
2774 * megasas_reset_bus_host - Bus & host reset handler entry point
2775 */
2776static int megasas_reset_bus_host(struct scsi_cmnd *scmd)
2777{
2778 int ret;
2779 struct megasas_instance *instance;
2780
2781 instance = (struct megasas_instance *)scmd->device->host->hostdata;
2782
2783 scmd_printk(KERN_INFO, scmd,
2784 "Controller reset is requested due to IO timeout\n"
2785 "SCSI command pointer: (%p)\t SCSI host state: %d\t"
2786 " SCSI host busy: %d\t FW outstanding: %d\n",
2787 scmd, scmd->device->host->shost_state,
2788 atomic_read((atomic_t *)&scmd->device->host->host_busy),
2789 atomic_read(&instance->fw_outstanding));
2790
2791 /*
2792 * First wait for all commands to complete
2793 */
2794 if (instance->adapter_type == MFI_SERIES) {
2795 ret = megasas_generic_reset(scmd);
2796 } else {
2797 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *cmd;
2798 cmd = (struct megasas_cmd_fusion *)scmd->SCp.ptr;
2799 if (cmd)
2800 megasas_dump_frame(cmd->io_request,
2801 MEGA_MPI2_RAID_DEFAULT_IO_FRAME_SIZE);
2802 ret = megasas_reset_fusion(scmd->device->host,
2803 SCSIIO_TIMEOUT_OCR);
2804 }
2805
2806 return ret;
2807}
2808
2809/**
2810 * megasas_task_abort - Issues task abort request to firmware
2811 * (supported only for fusion adapters)
2812 * @scmd: SCSI command pointer
2813 */
2814static int megasas_task_abort(struct scsi_cmnd *scmd)
2815{
2816 int ret;
2817 struct megasas_instance *instance;
2818
2819 instance = (struct megasas_instance *)scmd->device->host->hostdata;
2820
2821 if (instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES)
2822 ret = megasas_task_abort_fusion(scmd);
2823 else {
2824 sdev_printk(KERN_NOTICE, scmd->device, "TASK ABORT not supported\n");
2825 ret = FAILED;
2826 }
2827
2828 return ret;
2829}
2830
2831/**
2832 * megasas_reset_target: Issues target reset request to firmware
2833 * (supported only for fusion adapters)
2834 * @scmd: SCSI command pointer
2835 */
2836static int megasas_reset_target(struct scsi_cmnd *scmd)
2837{
2838 int ret;
2839 struct megasas_instance *instance;
2840
2841 instance = (struct megasas_instance *)scmd->device->host->hostdata;
2842
2843 if (instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES)
2844 ret = megasas_reset_target_fusion(scmd);
2845 else {
2846 sdev_printk(KERN_NOTICE, scmd->device, "TARGET RESET not supported\n");
2847 ret = FAILED;
2848 }
2849
2850 return ret;
2851}
2852
2853/**
2854 * megasas_bios_param - Returns disk geometry for a disk
2855 * @sdev: device handle
2856 * @bdev: block device
2857 * @capacity: drive capacity
2858 * @geom: geometry parameters
2859 */
2860static int
2861megasas_bios_param(struct scsi_device *sdev, struct block_device *bdev,
2862 sector_t capacity, int geom[])
2863{
2864 int heads;
2865 int sectors;
2866 sector_t cylinders;
2867 unsigned long tmp;
2868
2869 /* Default heads (64) & sectors (32) */
2870 heads = 64;
2871 sectors = 32;
2872
2873 tmp = heads * sectors;
2874 cylinders = capacity;
2875
2876 sector_div(cylinders, tmp);
2877
2878 /*
2879 * Handle extended translation size for logical drives > 1Gb
2880 */
2881
2882 if (capacity >= 0x200000) {
2883 heads = 255;
2884 sectors = 63;
2885 tmp = heads*sectors;
2886 cylinders = capacity;
2887 sector_div(cylinders, tmp);
2888 }
2889
2890 geom[0] = heads;
2891 geom[1] = sectors;
2892 geom[2] = cylinders;
2893
2894 return 0;
2895}
2896
2897static void megasas_aen_polling(struct work_struct *work);
2898
2899/**
2900 * megasas_service_aen - Processes an event notification
2901 * @instance: Adapter soft state
2902 * @cmd: AEN command completed by the ISR
2903 *
2904 * For AEN, driver sends a command down to FW that is held by the FW till an
2905 * event occurs. When an event of interest occurs, FW completes the command
2906 * that it was previously holding.
2907 *
2908 * This routines sends SIGIO signal to processes that have registered with the
2909 * driver for AEN.
2910 */
2911static void
2912megasas_service_aen(struct megasas_instance *instance, struct megasas_cmd *cmd)
2913{
2914 unsigned long flags;
2915
2916 /*
2917 * Don't signal app if it is just an aborted previously registered aen
2918 */
2919 if ((!cmd->abort_aen) && (instance->unload == 0)) {
2920 spin_lock_irqsave(&poll_aen_lock, flags);
2921 megasas_poll_wait_aen = 1;
2922 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&poll_aen_lock, flags);
2923 wake_up(&megasas_poll_wait);
2924 kill_fasync(&megasas_async_queue, SIGIO, POLL_IN);
2925 }
2926 else
2927 cmd->abort_aen = 0;
2928
2929 instance->aen_cmd = NULL;
2930
2931 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
2932
2933 if ((instance->unload == 0) &&
2934 ((instance->issuepend_done == 1))) {
2935 struct megasas_aen_event *ev;
2936
2937 ev = kzalloc(sizeof(*ev), GFP_ATOMIC);
2938 if (!ev) {
2939 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "megasas_service_aen: out of memory\n");
2940 } else {
2941 ev->instance = instance;
2942 instance->ev = ev;
2943 INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&ev->hotplug_work,
2944 megasas_aen_polling);
2945 schedule_delayed_work(&ev->hotplug_work, 0);
2946 }
2947 }
2948}
2949
2950static ssize_t
2951megasas_fw_crash_buffer_store(struct device *cdev,
2952 struct device_attribute *attr, const char *buf, size_t count)
2953{
2954 struct Scsi_Host *shost = class_to_shost(cdev);
2955 struct megasas_instance *instance =
2956 (struct megasas_instance *) shost->hostdata;
2957 int val = 0;
2958 unsigned long flags;
2959
2960 if (kstrtoint(buf, 0, &val) != 0)
2961 return -EINVAL;
2962
2963 spin_lock_irqsave(&instance->crashdump_lock, flags);
2964 instance->fw_crash_buffer_offset = val;
2965 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->crashdump_lock, flags);
2966 return strlen(buf);
2967}
2968
2969static ssize_t
2970megasas_fw_crash_buffer_show(struct device *cdev,
2971 struct device_attribute *attr, char *buf)
2972{
2973 struct Scsi_Host *shost = class_to_shost(cdev);
2974 struct megasas_instance *instance =
2975 (struct megasas_instance *) shost->hostdata;
2976 u32 size;
2977 unsigned long buff_addr;
2978 unsigned long dmachunk = CRASH_DMA_BUF_SIZE;
2979 unsigned long src_addr;
2980 unsigned long flags;
2981 u32 buff_offset;
2982
2983 spin_lock_irqsave(&instance->crashdump_lock, flags);
2984 buff_offset = instance->fw_crash_buffer_offset;
2985 if (!instance->crash_dump_buf &&
2986 !((instance->fw_crash_state == AVAILABLE) ||
2987 (instance->fw_crash_state == COPYING))) {
2988 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
2989 "Firmware crash dump is not available\n");
2990 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->crashdump_lock, flags);
2991 return -EINVAL;
2992 }
2993
2994 buff_addr = (unsigned long) buf;
2995
2996 if (buff_offset > (instance->fw_crash_buffer_size * dmachunk)) {
2997 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
2998 "Firmware crash dump offset is out of range\n");
2999 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->crashdump_lock, flags);
3000 return 0;
3001 }
3002
3003 size = (instance->fw_crash_buffer_size * dmachunk) - buff_offset;
3004 size = (size >= PAGE_SIZE) ? (PAGE_SIZE - 1) : size;
3005
3006 src_addr = (unsigned long)instance->crash_buf[buff_offset / dmachunk] +
3007 (buff_offset % dmachunk);
3008 memcpy(buf, (void *)src_addr, size);
3009 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->crashdump_lock, flags);
3010
3011 return size;
3012}
3013
3014static ssize_t
3015megasas_fw_crash_buffer_size_show(struct device *cdev,
3016 struct device_attribute *attr, char *buf)
3017{
3018 struct Scsi_Host *shost = class_to_shost(cdev);
3019 struct megasas_instance *instance =
3020 (struct megasas_instance *) shost->hostdata;
3021
3022 return snprintf(buf, PAGE_SIZE, "%ld\n", (unsigned long)
3023 ((instance->fw_crash_buffer_size) * 1024 * 1024)/PAGE_SIZE);
3024}
3025
3026static ssize_t
3027megasas_fw_crash_state_store(struct device *cdev,
3028 struct device_attribute *attr, const char *buf, size_t count)
3029{
3030 struct Scsi_Host *shost = class_to_shost(cdev);
3031 struct megasas_instance *instance =
3032 (struct megasas_instance *) shost->hostdata;
3033 int val = 0;
3034 unsigned long flags;
3035
3036 if (kstrtoint(buf, 0, &val) != 0)
3037 return -EINVAL;
3038
3039 if ((val <= AVAILABLE || val > COPY_ERROR)) {
3040 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "application updates invalid "
3041 "firmware crash state\n");
3042 return -EINVAL;
3043 }
3044
3045 instance->fw_crash_state = val;
3046
3047 if ((val == COPIED) || (val == COPY_ERROR)) {
3048 spin_lock_irqsave(&instance->crashdump_lock, flags);
3049 megasas_free_host_crash_buffer(instance);
3050 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->crashdump_lock, flags);
3051 if (val == COPY_ERROR)
3052 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "application failed to "
3053 "copy Firmware crash dump\n");
3054 else
3055 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Firmware crash dump "
3056 "copied successfully\n");
3057 }
3058 return strlen(buf);
3059}
3060
3061static ssize_t
3062megasas_fw_crash_state_show(struct device *cdev,
3063 struct device_attribute *attr, char *buf)
3064{
3065 struct Scsi_Host *shost = class_to_shost(cdev);
3066 struct megasas_instance *instance =
3067 (struct megasas_instance *) shost->hostdata;
3068
3069 return snprintf(buf, PAGE_SIZE, "%d\n", instance->fw_crash_state);
3070}
3071
3072static ssize_t
3073megasas_page_size_show(struct device *cdev,
3074 struct device_attribute *attr, char *buf)
3075{
3076 return snprintf(buf, PAGE_SIZE, "%ld\n", (unsigned long)PAGE_SIZE - 1);
3077}
3078
3079static ssize_t
3080megasas_ldio_outstanding_show(struct device *cdev, struct device_attribute *attr,
3081 char *buf)
3082{
3083 struct Scsi_Host *shost = class_to_shost(cdev);
3084 struct megasas_instance *instance = (struct megasas_instance *)shost->hostdata;
3085
3086 return snprintf(buf, PAGE_SIZE, "%d\n", atomic_read(&instance->ldio_outstanding));
3087}
3088
3089static DEVICE_ATTR(fw_crash_buffer, S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR,
3090 megasas_fw_crash_buffer_show, megasas_fw_crash_buffer_store);
3091static DEVICE_ATTR(fw_crash_buffer_size, S_IRUGO,
3092 megasas_fw_crash_buffer_size_show, NULL);
3093static DEVICE_ATTR(fw_crash_state, S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR,
3094 megasas_fw_crash_state_show, megasas_fw_crash_state_store);
3095static DEVICE_ATTR(page_size, S_IRUGO,
3096 megasas_page_size_show, NULL);
3097static DEVICE_ATTR(ldio_outstanding, S_IRUGO,
3098 megasas_ldio_outstanding_show, NULL);
3099
3100struct device_attribute *megaraid_host_attrs[] = {
3101 &dev_attr_fw_crash_buffer_size,
3102 &dev_attr_fw_crash_buffer,
3103 &dev_attr_fw_crash_state,
3104 &dev_attr_page_size,
3105 &dev_attr_ldio_outstanding,
3106 NULL,
3107};
3108
3109/*
3110 * Scsi host template for megaraid_sas driver
3111 */
3112static struct scsi_host_template megasas_template = {
3113
3114 .module = THIS_MODULE,
3115 .name = "Avago SAS based MegaRAID driver",
3116 .proc_name = "megaraid_sas",
3117 .slave_configure = megasas_slave_configure,
3118 .slave_alloc = megasas_slave_alloc,
3119 .slave_destroy = megasas_slave_destroy,
3120 .queuecommand = megasas_queue_command,
3121 .eh_target_reset_handler = megasas_reset_target,
3122 .eh_abort_handler = megasas_task_abort,
3123 .eh_host_reset_handler = megasas_reset_bus_host,
3124 .eh_timed_out = megasas_reset_timer,
3125 .shost_attrs = megaraid_host_attrs,
3126 .bios_param = megasas_bios_param,
3127 .use_clustering = ENABLE_CLUSTERING,
3128 .change_queue_depth = scsi_change_queue_depth,
3129 .no_write_same = 1,
3130};
3131
3132/**
3133 * megasas_complete_int_cmd - Completes an internal command
3134 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3135 * @cmd: Command to be completed
3136 *
3137 * The megasas_issue_blocked_cmd() function waits for a command to complete
3138 * after it issues a command. This function wakes up that waiting routine by
3139 * calling wake_up() on the wait queue.
3140 */
3141static void
3142megasas_complete_int_cmd(struct megasas_instance *instance,
3143 struct megasas_cmd *cmd)
3144{
3145 cmd->cmd_status_drv = cmd->frame->io.cmd_status;
3146 wake_up(&instance->int_cmd_wait_q);
3147}
3148
3149/**
3150 * megasas_complete_abort - Completes aborting a command
3151 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3152 * @cmd: Cmd that was issued to abort another cmd
3153 *
3154 * The megasas_issue_blocked_abort_cmd() function waits on abort_cmd_wait_q
3155 * after it issues an abort on a previously issued command. This function
3156 * wakes up all functions waiting on the same wait queue.
3157 */
3158static void
3159megasas_complete_abort(struct megasas_instance *instance,
3160 struct megasas_cmd *cmd)
3161{
3162 if (cmd->sync_cmd) {
3163 cmd->sync_cmd = 0;
3164 cmd->cmd_status_drv = 0;
3165 wake_up(&instance->abort_cmd_wait_q);
3166 }
3167}
3168
3169/**
3170 * megasas_complete_cmd - Completes a command
3171 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3172 * @cmd: Command to be completed
3173 * @alt_status: If non-zero, use this value as status to
3174 * SCSI mid-layer instead of the value returned
3175 * by the FW. This should be used if caller wants
3176 * an alternate status (as in the case of aborted
3177 * commands)
3178 */
3179void
3180megasas_complete_cmd(struct megasas_instance *instance, struct megasas_cmd *cmd,
3181 u8 alt_status)
3182{
3183 int exception = 0;
3184 struct megasas_header *hdr = &cmd->frame->hdr;
3185 unsigned long flags;
3186 struct fusion_context *fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
3187 u32 opcode, status;
3188
3189 /* flag for the retry reset */
3190 cmd->retry_for_fw_reset = 0;
3191
3192 if (cmd->scmd)
3193 cmd->scmd->SCp.ptr = NULL;
3194
3195 switch (hdr->cmd) {
3196 case MFI_CMD_INVALID:
3197 /* Some older 1068 controller FW may keep a pended
3198 MR_DCMD_CTRL_EVENT_GET_INFO left over from the main kernel
3199 when booting the kdump kernel. Ignore this command to
3200 prevent a kernel panic on shutdown of the kdump kernel. */
3201 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev, "MFI_CMD_INVALID command "
3202 "completed\n");
3203 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev, "If you have a controller "
3204 "other than PERC5, please upgrade your firmware\n");
3205 break;
3206 case MFI_CMD_PD_SCSI_IO:
3207 case MFI_CMD_LD_SCSI_IO:
3208
3209 /*
3210 * MFI_CMD_PD_SCSI_IO and MFI_CMD_LD_SCSI_IO could have been
3211 * issued either through an IO path or an IOCTL path. If it
3212 * was via IOCTL, we will send it to internal completion.
3213 */
3214 if (cmd->sync_cmd) {
3215 cmd->sync_cmd = 0;
3216 megasas_complete_int_cmd(instance, cmd);
3217 break;
3218 }
3219
3220 case MFI_CMD_LD_READ:
3221 case MFI_CMD_LD_WRITE:
3222
3223 if (alt_status) {
3224 cmd->scmd->result = alt_status << 16;
3225 exception = 1;
3226 }
3227
3228 if (exception) {
3229
3230 atomic_dec(&instance->fw_outstanding);
3231
3232 scsi_dma_unmap(cmd->scmd);
3233 cmd->scmd->scsi_done(cmd->scmd);
3234 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
3235
3236 break;
3237 }
3238
3239 switch (hdr->cmd_status) {
3240
3241 case MFI_STAT_OK:
3242 cmd->scmd->result = DID_OK << 16;
3243 break;
3244
3245 case MFI_STAT_SCSI_IO_FAILED:
3246 case MFI_STAT_LD_INIT_IN_PROGRESS:
3247 cmd->scmd->result =
3248 (DID_ERROR << 16) | hdr->scsi_status;
3249 break;
3250
3251 case MFI_STAT_SCSI_DONE_WITH_ERROR:
3252
3253 cmd->scmd->result = (DID_OK << 16) | hdr->scsi_status;
3254
3255 if (hdr->scsi_status == SAM_STAT_CHECK_CONDITION) {
3256 memset(cmd->scmd->sense_buffer, 0,
3257 SCSI_SENSE_BUFFERSIZE);
3258 memcpy(cmd->scmd->sense_buffer, cmd->sense,
3259 hdr->sense_len);
3260
3261 cmd->scmd->result |= DRIVER_SENSE << 24;
3262 }
3263
3264 break;
3265
3266 case MFI_STAT_LD_OFFLINE:
3267 case MFI_STAT_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND:
3268 cmd->scmd->result = DID_BAD_TARGET << 16;
3269 break;
3270
3271 default:
3272 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "MFI FW status %#x\n",
3273 hdr->cmd_status);
3274 cmd->scmd->result = DID_ERROR << 16;
3275 break;
3276 }
3277
3278 atomic_dec(&instance->fw_outstanding);
3279
3280 scsi_dma_unmap(cmd->scmd);
3281 cmd->scmd->scsi_done(cmd->scmd);
3282 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
3283
3284 break;
3285
3286 case MFI_CMD_SMP:
3287 case MFI_CMD_STP:
3288 case MFI_CMD_DCMD:
3289 opcode = le32_to_cpu(cmd->frame->dcmd.opcode);
3290 /* Check for LD map update */
3291 if ((opcode == MR_DCMD_LD_MAP_GET_INFO)
3292 && (cmd->frame->dcmd.mbox.b[1] == 1)) {
3293 fusion->fast_path_io = 0;
3294 spin_lock_irqsave(instance->host->host_lock, flags);
3295 instance->map_update_cmd = NULL;
3296 if (cmd->frame->hdr.cmd_status != 0) {
3297 if (cmd->frame->hdr.cmd_status !=
3298 MFI_STAT_NOT_FOUND)
3299 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev, "map syncfailed, status = 0x%x\n",
3300 cmd->frame->hdr.cmd_status);
3301 else {
3302 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
3303 spin_unlock_irqrestore(
3304 instance->host->host_lock,
3305 flags);
3306 break;
3307 }
3308 } else
3309 instance->map_id++;
3310 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
3311
3312 /*
3313 * Set fast path IO to ZERO.
3314 * Validate Map will set proper value.
3315 * Meanwhile all IOs will go as LD IO.
3316 */
3317 if (MR_ValidateMapInfo(instance))
3318 fusion->fast_path_io = 1;
3319 else
3320 fusion->fast_path_io = 0;
3321 megasas_sync_map_info(instance);
3322 spin_unlock_irqrestore(instance->host->host_lock,
3323 flags);
3324 break;
3325 }
3326 if (opcode == MR_DCMD_CTRL_EVENT_GET_INFO ||
3327 opcode == MR_DCMD_CTRL_EVENT_GET) {
3328 spin_lock_irqsave(&poll_aen_lock, flags);
3329 megasas_poll_wait_aen = 0;
3330 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&poll_aen_lock, flags);
3331 }
3332
3333 /* FW has an updated PD sequence */
3334 if ((opcode == MR_DCMD_SYSTEM_PD_MAP_GET_INFO) &&
3335 (cmd->frame->dcmd.mbox.b[0] == 1)) {
3336
3337 spin_lock_irqsave(instance->host->host_lock, flags);
3338 status = cmd->frame->hdr.cmd_status;
3339 instance->jbod_seq_cmd = NULL;
3340 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
3341
3342 if (status == MFI_STAT_OK) {
3343 instance->pd_seq_map_id++;
3344 /* Re-register a pd sync seq num cmd */
3345 if (megasas_sync_pd_seq_num(instance, true))
3346 instance->use_seqnum_jbod_fp = false;
3347 } else
3348 instance->use_seqnum_jbod_fp = false;
3349
3350 spin_unlock_irqrestore(instance->host->host_lock, flags);
3351 break;
3352 }
3353
3354 /*
3355 * See if got an event notification
3356 */
3357 if (opcode == MR_DCMD_CTRL_EVENT_WAIT)
3358 megasas_service_aen(instance, cmd);
3359 else
3360 megasas_complete_int_cmd(instance, cmd);
3361
3362 break;
3363
3364 case MFI_CMD_ABORT:
3365 /*
3366 * Cmd issued to abort another cmd returned
3367 */
3368 megasas_complete_abort(instance, cmd);
3369 break;
3370
3371 default:
3372 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Unknown command completed! [0x%X]\n",
3373 hdr->cmd);
3374 break;
3375 }
3376}
3377
3378/**
3379 * megasas_issue_pending_cmds_again - issue all pending cmds
3380 * in FW again because of the fw reset
3381 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3382 */
3383static inline void
3384megasas_issue_pending_cmds_again(struct megasas_instance *instance)
3385{
3386 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
3387 struct list_head clist_local;
3388 union megasas_evt_class_locale class_locale;
3389 unsigned long flags;
3390 u32 seq_num;
3391
3392 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&clist_local);
3393 spin_lock_irqsave(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
3394 list_splice_init(&instance->internal_reset_pending_q, &clist_local);
3395 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
3396
3397 while (!list_empty(&clist_local)) {
3398 cmd = list_entry((&clist_local)->next,
3399 struct megasas_cmd, list);
3400 list_del_init(&cmd->list);
3401
3402 if (cmd->sync_cmd || cmd->scmd) {
3403 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "command %p, %p:%d"
3404 "detected to be pending while HBA reset\n",
3405 cmd, cmd->scmd, cmd->sync_cmd);
3406
3407 cmd->retry_for_fw_reset++;
3408
3409 if (cmd->retry_for_fw_reset == 3) {
3410 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "cmd %p, %p:%d"
3411 "was tried multiple times during reset."
3412 "Shutting down the HBA\n",
3413 cmd, cmd->scmd, cmd->sync_cmd);
3414 instance->instancet->disable_intr(instance);
3415 atomic_set(&instance->fw_reset_no_pci_access, 1);
3416 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
3417 return;
3418 }
3419 }
3420
3421 if (cmd->sync_cmd == 1) {
3422 if (cmd->scmd) {
3423 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "unexpected"
3424 "cmd attached to internal command!\n");
3425 }
3426 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "%p synchronous cmd"
3427 "on the internal reset queue,"
3428 "issue it again.\n", cmd);
3429 cmd->cmd_status_drv = MFI_STAT_INVALID_STATUS;
3430 instance->instancet->fire_cmd(instance,
3431 cmd->frame_phys_addr,
3432 0, instance->reg_set);
3433 } else if (cmd->scmd) {
3434 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "%p scsi cmd [%02x]"
3435 "detected on the internal queue, issue again.\n",
3436 cmd, cmd->scmd->cmnd[0]);
3437
3438 atomic_inc(&instance->fw_outstanding);
3439 instance->instancet->fire_cmd(instance,
3440 cmd->frame_phys_addr,
3441 cmd->frame_count-1, instance->reg_set);
3442 } else {
3443 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "%p unexpected cmd on the"
3444 "internal reset defer list while re-issue!!\n",
3445 cmd);
3446 }
3447 }
3448
3449 if (instance->aen_cmd) {
3450 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "aen_cmd in def process\n");
3451 megasas_return_cmd(instance, instance->aen_cmd);
3452
3453 instance->aen_cmd = NULL;
3454 }
3455
3456 /*
3457 * Initiate AEN (Asynchronous Event Notification)
3458 */
3459 seq_num = instance->last_seq_num;
3460 class_locale.members.reserved = 0;
3461 class_locale.members.locale = MR_EVT_LOCALE_ALL;
3462 class_locale.members.class = MR_EVT_CLASS_DEBUG;
3463
3464 megasas_register_aen(instance, seq_num, class_locale.word);
3465}
3466
3467/**
3468 * Move the internal reset pending commands to a deferred queue.
3469 *
3470 * We move the commands pending at internal reset time to a
3471 * pending queue. This queue would be flushed after successful
3472 * completion of the internal reset sequence. if the internal reset
3473 * did not complete in time, the kernel reset handler would flush
3474 * these commands.
3475 **/
3476static void
3477megasas_internal_reset_defer_cmds(struct megasas_instance *instance)
3478{
3479 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
3480 int i;
3481 u16 max_cmd = instance->max_fw_cmds;
3482 u32 defer_index;
3483 unsigned long flags;
3484
3485 defer_index = 0;
3486 spin_lock_irqsave(&instance->mfi_pool_lock, flags);
3487 for (i = 0; i < max_cmd; i++) {
3488 cmd = instance->cmd_list[i];
3489 if (cmd->sync_cmd == 1 || cmd->scmd) {
3490 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "moving cmd[%d]:%p:%d:%p"
3491 "on the defer queue as internal\n",
3492 defer_index, cmd, cmd->sync_cmd, cmd->scmd);
3493
3494 if (!list_empty(&cmd->list)) {
3495 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "ERROR while"
3496 " moving this cmd:%p, %d %p, it was"
3497 "discovered on some list?\n",
3498 cmd, cmd->sync_cmd, cmd->scmd);
3499
3500 list_del_init(&cmd->list);
3501 }
3502 defer_index++;
3503 list_add_tail(&cmd->list,
3504 &instance->internal_reset_pending_q);
3505 }
3506 }
3507 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->mfi_pool_lock, flags);
3508}
3509
3510
3511static void
3512process_fw_state_change_wq(struct work_struct *work)
3513{
3514 struct megasas_instance *instance =
3515 container_of(work, struct megasas_instance, work_init);
3516 u32 wait;
3517 unsigned long flags;
3518
3519 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) != MEGASAS_ADPRESET_SM_INFAULT) {
3520 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "error, recovery st %x\n",
3521 atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery));
3522 return ;
3523 }
3524
3525 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_ADPRESET_SM_INFAULT) {
3526 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "FW detected to be in fault"
3527 "state, restarting it...\n");
3528
3529 instance->instancet->disable_intr(instance);
3530 atomic_set(&instance->fw_outstanding, 0);
3531
3532 atomic_set(&instance->fw_reset_no_pci_access, 1);
3533 instance->instancet->adp_reset(instance, instance->reg_set);
3534 atomic_set(&instance->fw_reset_no_pci_access, 0);
3535
3536 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "FW restarted successfully,"
3537 "initiating next stage...\n");
3538
3539 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "HBA recovery state machine,"
3540 "state 2 starting...\n");
3541
3542 /* waiting for about 20 second before start the second init */
3543 for (wait = 0; wait < 30; wait++) {
3544 msleep(1000);
3545 }
3546
3547 if (megasas_transition_to_ready(instance, 1)) {
3548 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "adapter not ready\n");
3549
3550 atomic_set(&instance->fw_reset_no_pci_access, 1);
3551 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
3552 return ;
3553 }
3554
3555 if ((instance->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS1064R) ||
3556 (instance->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_DELL_PERC5) ||
3557 (instance->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_VERDE_ZCR)
3558 ) {
3559 *instance->consumer = *instance->producer;
3560 } else {
3561 *instance->consumer = 0;
3562 *instance->producer = 0;
3563 }
3564
3565 megasas_issue_init_mfi(instance);
3566
3567 spin_lock_irqsave(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
3568 atomic_set(&instance->adprecovery, MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL);
3569 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
3570 instance->instancet->enable_intr(instance);
3571
3572 megasas_issue_pending_cmds_again(instance);
3573 instance->issuepend_done = 1;
3574 }
3575}
3576
3577/**
3578 * megasas_deplete_reply_queue - Processes all completed commands
3579 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3580 * @alt_status: Alternate status to be returned to
3581 * SCSI mid-layer instead of the status
3582 * returned by the FW
3583 * Note: this must be called with hba lock held
3584 */
3585static int
3586megasas_deplete_reply_queue(struct megasas_instance *instance,
3587 u8 alt_status)
3588{
3589 u32 mfiStatus;
3590 u32 fw_state;
3591
3592 if ((mfiStatus = instance->instancet->check_reset(instance,
3593 instance->reg_set)) == 1) {
3594 return IRQ_HANDLED;
3595 }
3596
3597 if ((mfiStatus = instance->instancet->clear_intr(
3598 instance->reg_set)
3599 ) == 0) {
3600 /* Hardware may not set outbound_intr_status in MSI-X mode */
3601 if (!instance->msix_vectors)
3602 return IRQ_NONE;
3603 }
3604
3605 instance->mfiStatus = mfiStatus;
3606
3607 if ((mfiStatus & MFI_INTR_FLAG_FIRMWARE_STATE_CHANGE)) {
3608 fw_state = instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg(
3609 instance->reg_set) & MFI_STATE_MASK;
3610
3611 if (fw_state != MFI_STATE_FAULT) {
3612 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "fw state:%x\n",
3613 fw_state);
3614 }
3615
3616 if ((fw_state == MFI_STATE_FAULT) &&
3617 (instance->disableOnlineCtrlReset == 0)) {
3618 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "wait adp restart\n");
3619
3620 if ((instance->pdev->device ==
3621 PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS1064R) ||
3622 (instance->pdev->device ==
3623 PCI_DEVICE_ID_DELL_PERC5) ||
3624 (instance->pdev->device ==
3625 PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_VERDE_ZCR)) {
3626
3627 *instance->consumer =
3628 cpu_to_le32(MEGASAS_ADPRESET_INPROG_SIGN);
3629 }
3630
3631
3632 instance->instancet->disable_intr(instance);
3633 atomic_set(&instance->adprecovery, MEGASAS_ADPRESET_SM_INFAULT);
3634 instance->issuepend_done = 0;
3635
3636 atomic_set(&instance->fw_outstanding, 0);
3637 megasas_internal_reset_defer_cmds(instance);
3638
3639 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "fwState=%x, stage:%d\n",
3640 fw_state, atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery));
3641
3642 schedule_work(&instance->work_init);
3643 return IRQ_HANDLED;
3644
3645 } else {
3646 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "fwstate:%x, dis_OCR=%x\n",
3647 fw_state, instance->disableOnlineCtrlReset);
3648 }
3649 }
3650
3651 tasklet_schedule(&instance->isr_tasklet);
3652 return IRQ_HANDLED;
3653}
3654/**
3655 * megasas_isr - isr entry point
3656 */
3657static irqreturn_t megasas_isr(int irq, void *devp)
3658{
3659 struct megasas_irq_context *irq_context = devp;
3660 struct megasas_instance *instance = irq_context->instance;
3661 unsigned long flags;
3662 irqreturn_t rc;
3663
3664 if (atomic_read(&instance->fw_reset_no_pci_access))
3665 return IRQ_HANDLED;
3666
3667 spin_lock_irqsave(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
3668 rc = megasas_deplete_reply_queue(instance, DID_OK);
3669 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
3670
3671 return rc;
3672}
3673
3674/**
3675 * megasas_transition_to_ready - Move the FW to READY state
3676 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3677 *
3678 * During the initialization, FW passes can potentially be in any one of
3679 * several possible states. If the FW in operational, waiting-for-handshake
3680 * states, driver must take steps to bring it to ready state. Otherwise, it
3681 * has to wait for the ready state.
3682 */
3683int
3684megasas_transition_to_ready(struct megasas_instance *instance, int ocr)
3685{
3686 int i;
3687 u8 max_wait;
3688 u32 fw_state;
3689 u32 cur_state;
3690 u32 abs_state, curr_abs_state;
3691
3692 abs_state = instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg(instance->reg_set);
3693 fw_state = abs_state & MFI_STATE_MASK;
3694
3695 if (fw_state != MFI_STATE_READY)
3696 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Waiting for FW to come to ready"
3697 " state\n");
3698
3699 while (fw_state != MFI_STATE_READY) {
3700
3701 switch (fw_state) {
3702
3703 case MFI_STATE_FAULT:
3704 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "FW in FAULT state!!\n");
3705 if (ocr) {
3706 max_wait = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME;
3707 cur_state = MFI_STATE_FAULT;
3708 break;
3709 } else
3710 return -ENODEV;
3711
3712 case MFI_STATE_WAIT_HANDSHAKE:
3713 /*
3714 * Set the CLR bit in inbound doorbell
3715 */
3716 if ((instance->pdev->device ==
3717 PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS0073SKINNY) ||
3718 (instance->pdev->device ==
3719 PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS0071SKINNY) ||
3720 (instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES))
3721 writel(
3722 MFI_INIT_CLEAR_HANDSHAKE|MFI_INIT_HOTPLUG,
3723 &instance->reg_set->doorbell);
3724 else
3725 writel(
3726 MFI_INIT_CLEAR_HANDSHAKE|MFI_INIT_HOTPLUG,
3727 &instance->reg_set->inbound_doorbell);
3728
3729 max_wait = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME;
3730 cur_state = MFI_STATE_WAIT_HANDSHAKE;
3731 break;
3732
3733 case MFI_STATE_BOOT_MESSAGE_PENDING:
3734 if ((instance->pdev->device ==
3735 PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS0073SKINNY) ||
3736 (instance->pdev->device ==
3737 PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS0071SKINNY) ||
3738 (instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES))
3739 writel(MFI_INIT_HOTPLUG,
3740 &instance->reg_set->doorbell);
3741 else
3742 writel(MFI_INIT_HOTPLUG,
3743 &instance->reg_set->inbound_doorbell);
3744
3745 max_wait = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME;
3746 cur_state = MFI_STATE_BOOT_MESSAGE_PENDING;
3747 break;
3748
3749 case MFI_STATE_OPERATIONAL:
3750 /*
3751 * Bring it to READY state; assuming max wait 10 secs
3752 */
3753 instance->instancet->disable_intr(instance);
3754 if ((instance->pdev->device ==
3755 PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS0073SKINNY) ||
3756 (instance->pdev->device ==
3757 PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS0071SKINNY) ||
3758 (instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES)) {
3759 writel(MFI_RESET_FLAGS,
3760 &instance->reg_set->doorbell);
3761
3762 if (instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES) {
3763 for (i = 0; i < (10 * 1000); i += 20) {
3764 if (readl(
3765 &instance->
3766 reg_set->
3767 doorbell) & 1)
3768 msleep(20);
3769 else
3770 break;
3771 }
3772 }
3773 } else
3774 writel(MFI_RESET_FLAGS,
3775 &instance->reg_set->inbound_doorbell);
3776
3777 max_wait = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME;
3778 cur_state = MFI_STATE_OPERATIONAL;
3779 break;
3780
3781 case MFI_STATE_UNDEFINED:
3782 /*
3783 * This state should not last for more than 2 seconds
3784 */
3785 max_wait = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME;
3786 cur_state = MFI_STATE_UNDEFINED;
3787 break;
3788
3789 case MFI_STATE_BB_INIT:
3790 max_wait = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME;
3791 cur_state = MFI_STATE_BB_INIT;
3792 break;
3793
3794 case MFI_STATE_FW_INIT:
3795 max_wait = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME;
3796 cur_state = MFI_STATE_FW_INIT;
3797 break;
3798
3799 case MFI_STATE_FW_INIT_2:
3800 max_wait = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME;
3801 cur_state = MFI_STATE_FW_INIT_2;
3802 break;
3803
3804 case MFI_STATE_DEVICE_SCAN:
3805 max_wait = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME;
3806 cur_state = MFI_STATE_DEVICE_SCAN;
3807 break;
3808
3809 case MFI_STATE_FLUSH_CACHE:
3810 max_wait = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME;
3811 cur_state = MFI_STATE_FLUSH_CACHE;
3812 break;
3813
3814 default:
3815 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "Unknown state 0x%x\n",
3816 fw_state);
3817 return -ENODEV;
3818 }
3819
3820 /*
3821 * The cur_state should not last for more than max_wait secs
3822 */
3823 for (i = 0; i < (max_wait * 1000); i++) {
3824 curr_abs_state = instance->instancet->
3825 read_fw_status_reg(instance->reg_set);
3826
3827 if (abs_state == curr_abs_state) {
3828 msleep(1);
3829 } else
3830 break;
3831 }
3832
3833 /*
3834 * Return error if fw_state hasn't changed after max_wait
3835 */
3836 if (curr_abs_state == abs_state) {
3837 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "FW state [%d] hasn't changed "
3838 "in %d secs\n", fw_state, max_wait);
3839 return -ENODEV;
3840 }
3841
3842 abs_state = curr_abs_state;
3843 fw_state = curr_abs_state & MFI_STATE_MASK;
3844 }
3845 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "FW now in Ready state\n");
3846
3847 return 0;
3848}
3849
3850/**
3851 * megasas_teardown_frame_pool - Destroy the cmd frame DMA pool
3852 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3853 */
3854static void megasas_teardown_frame_pool(struct megasas_instance *instance)
3855{
3856 int i;
3857 u16 max_cmd = instance->max_mfi_cmds;
3858 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
3859
3860 if (!instance->frame_dma_pool)
3861 return;
3862
3863 /*
3864 * Return all frames to pool
3865 */
3866 for (i = 0; i < max_cmd; i++) {
3867
3868 cmd = instance->cmd_list[i];
3869
3870 if (cmd->frame)
3871 dma_pool_free(instance->frame_dma_pool, cmd->frame,
3872 cmd->frame_phys_addr);
3873
3874 if (cmd->sense)
3875 dma_pool_free(instance->sense_dma_pool, cmd->sense,
3876 cmd->sense_phys_addr);
3877 }
3878
3879 /*
3880 * Now destroy the pool itself
3881 */
3882 dma_pool_destroy(instance->frame_dma_pool);
3883 dma_pool_destroy(instance->sense_dma_pool);
3884
3885 instance->frame_dma_pool = NULL;
3886 instance->sense_dma_pool = NULL;
3887}
3888
3889/**
3890 * megasas_create_frame_pool - Creates DMA pool for cmd frames
3891 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3892 *
3893 * Each command packet has an embedded DMA memory buffer that is used for
3894 * filling MFI frame and the SG list that immediately follows the frame. This
3895 * function creates those DMA memory buffers for each command packet by using
3896 * PCI pool facility.
3897 */
3898static int megasas_create_frame_pool(struct megasas_instance *instance)
3899{
3900 int i;
3901 u16 max_cmd;
3902 u32 sge_sz;
3903 u32 frame_count;
3904 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
3905
3906 max_cmd = instance->max_mfi_cmds;
3907
3908 /*
3909 * Size of our frame is 64 bytes for MFI frame, followed by max SG
3910 * elements and finally SCSI_SENSE_BUFFERSIZE bytes for sense buffer
3911 */
3912 sge_sz = (IS_DMA64) ? sizeof(struct megasas_sge64) :
3913 sizeof(struct megasas_sge32);
3914
3915 if (instance->flag_ieee)
3916 sge_sz = sizeof(struct megasas_sge_skinny);
3917
3918 /*
3919 * For MFI controllers.
3920 * max_num_sge = 60
3921 * max_sge_sz = 16 byte (sizeof megasas_sge_skinny)
3922 * Total 960 byte (15 MFI frame of 64 byte)
3923 *
3924 * Fusion adapter require only 3 extra frame.
3925 * max_num_sge = 16 (defined as MAX_IOCTL_SGE)
3926 * max_sge_sz = 12 byte (sizeof megasas_sge64)
3927 * Total 192 byte (3 MFI frame of 64 byte)
3928 */
3929 frame_count = (instance->adapter_type == MFI_SERIES) ?
3930 (15 + 1) : (3 + 1);
3931 instance->mfi_frame_size = MEGAMFI_FRAME_SIZE * frame_count;
3932 /*
3933 * Use DMA pool facility provided by PCI layer
3934 */
3935 instance->frame_dma_pool = dma_pool_create("megasas frame pool",
3936 &instance->pdev->dev,
3937 instance->mfi_frame_size, 256, 0);
3938
3939 if (!instance->frame_dma_pool) {
3940 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "failed to setup frame pool\n");
3941 return -ENOMEM;
3942 }
3943
3944 instance->sense_dma_pool = dma_pool_create("megasas sense pool",
3945 &instance->pdev->dev, 128,
3946 4, 0);
3947
3948 if (!instance->sense_dma_pool) {
3949 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "failed to setup sense pool\n");
3950
3951 dma_pool_destroy(instance->frame_dma_pool);
3952 instance->frame_dma_pool = NULL;
3953
3954 return -ENOMEM;
3955 }
3956
3957 /*
3958 * Allocate and attach a frame to each of the commands in cmd_list.
3959 * By making cmd->index as the context instead of the &cmd, we can
3960 * always use 32bit context regardless of the architecture
3961 */
3962 for (i = 0; i < max_cmd; i++) {
3963
3964 cmd = instance->cmd_list[i];
3965
3966 cmd->frame = dma_pool_alloc(instance->frame_dma_pool,
3967 GFP_KERNEL, &cmd->frame_phys_addr);
3968
3969 cmd->sense = dma_pool_alloc(instance->sense_dma_pool,
3970 GFP_KERNEL, &cmd->sense_phys_addr);
3971
3972 /*
3973 * megasas_teardown_frame_pool() takes care of freeing
3974 * whatever has been allocated
3975 */
3976 if (!cmd->frame || !cmd->sense) {
3977 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "dma_pool_alloc failed\n");
3978 megasas_teardown_frame_pool(instance);
3979 return -ENOMEM;
3980 }
3981
3982 memset(cmd->frame, 0, instance->mfi_frame_size);
3983 cmd->frame->io.context = cpu_to_le32(cmd->index);
3984 cmd->frame->io.pad_0 = 0;
3985 if ((instance->adapter_type == MFI_SERIES) && reset_devices)
3986 cmd->frame->hdr.cmd = MFI_CMD_INVALID;
3987 }
3988
3989 return 0;
3990}
3991
3992/**
3993 * megasas_free_cmds - Free all the cmds in the free cmd pool
3994 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3995 */
3996void megasas_free_cmds(struct megasas_instance *instance)
3997{
3998 int i;
3999
4000 /* First free the MFI frame pool */
4001 megasas_teardown_frame_pool(instance);
4002
4003 /* Free all the commands in the cmd_list */
4004 for (i = 0; i < instance->max_mfi_cmds; i++)
4005
4006 kfree(instance->cmd_list[i]);
4007
4008 /* Free the cmd_list buffer itself */
4009 kfree(instance->cmd_list);
4010 instance->cmd_list = NULL;
4011
4012 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&instance->cmd_pool);
4013}
4014
4015/**
4016 * megasas_alloc_cmds - Allocates the command packets
4017 * @instance: Adapter soft state
4018 *
4019 * Each command that is issued to the FW, whether IO commands from the OS or
4020 * internal commands like IOCTLs, are wrapped in local data structure called
4021 * megasas_cmd. The frame embedded in this megasas_cmd is actually issued to
4022 * the FW.
4023 *
4024 * Each frame has a 32-bit field called context (tag). This context is used
4025 * to get back the megasas_cmd from the frame when a frame gets completed in
4026 * the ISR. Typically the address of the megasas_cmd itself would be used as
4027 * the context. But we wanted to keep the differences between 32 and 64 bit
4028 * systems to the mininum. We always use 32 bit integers for the context. In
4029 * this driver, the 32 bit values are the indices into an array cmd_list.
4030 * This array is used only to look up the megasas_cmd given the context. The
4031 * free commands themselves are maintained in a linked list called cmd_pool.
4032 */
4033int megasas_alloc_cmds(struct megasas_instance *instance)
4034{
4035 int i;
4036 int j;
4037 u16 max_cmd;
4038 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
4039 struct fusion_context *fusion;
4040
4041 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
4042 max_cmd = instance->max_mfi_cmds;
4043
4044 /*
4045 * instance->cmd_list is an array of struct megasas_cmd pointers.
4046 * Allocate the dynamic array first and then allocate individual
4047 * commands.
4048 */
4049 instance->cmd_list = kcalloc(max_cmd, sizeof(struct megasas_cmd*), GFP_KERNEL);
4050
4051 if (!instance->cmd_list) {
4052 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "out of memory\n");
4053 return -ENOMEM;
4054 }
4055
4056 memset(instance->cmd_list, 0, sizeof(struct megasas_cmd *) *max_cmd);
4057
4058 for (i = 0; i < max_cmd; i++) {
4059 instance->cmd_list[i] = kmalloc(sizeof(struct megasas_cmd),
4060 GFP_KERNEL);
4061
4062 if (!instance->cmd_list[i]) {
4063
4064 for (j = 0; j < i; j++)
4065 kfree(instance->cmd_list[j]);
4066
4067 kfree(instance->cmd_list);
4068 instance->cmd_list = NULL;
4069
4070 return -ENOMEM;
4071 }
4072 }
4073
4074 for (i = 0; i < max_cmd; i++) {
4075 cmd = instance->cmd_list[i];
4076 memset(cmd, 0, sizeof(struct megasas_cmd));
4077 cmd->index = i;
4078 cmd->scmd = NULL;
4079 cmd->instance = instance;
4080
4081 list_add_tail(&cmd->list, &instance->cmd_pool);
4082 }
4083
4084 /*
4085 * Create a frame pool and assign one frame to each cmd
4086 */
4087 if (megasas_create_frame_pool(instance)) {
4088 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "Error creating frame DMA pool\n");
4089 megasas_free_cmds(instance);
4090 }
4091
4092 return 0;
4093}
4094
4095/*
4096 * dcmd_timeout_ocr_possible - Check if OCR is possible based on Driver/FW state.
4097 * @instance: Adapter soft state
4098 *
4099 * Return 0 for only Fusion adapter, if driver load/unload is not in progress
4100 * or FW is not under OCR.
4101 */
4102inline int
4103dcmd_timeout_ocr_possible(struct megasas_instance *instance) {
4104
4105 if (instance->adapter_type == MFI_SERIES)
4106 return KILL_ADAPTER;
4107 else if (instance->unload ||
4108 test_bit(MEGASAS_FUSION_IN_RESET, &instance->reset_flags))
4109 return IGNORE_TIMEOUT;
4110 else
4111 return INITIATE_OCR;
4112}
4113
4114static void
4115megasas_get_pd_info(struct megasas_instance *instance, struct scsi_device *sdev)
4116{
4117 int ret;
4118 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
4119 struct megasas_dcmd_frame *dcmd;
4120
4121 struct MR_PRIV_DEVICE *mr_device_priv_data;
4122 u16 device_id = 0;
4123
4124 device_id = (sdev->channel * MEGASAS_MAX_DEV_PER_CHANNEL) + sdev->id;
4125 cmd = megasas_get_cmd(instance);
4126
4127 if (!cmd) {
4128 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to get cmd %s\n", __func__);
4129 return;
4130 }
4131
4132 dcmd = &cmd->frame->dcmd;
4133
4134 memset(instance->pd_info, 0, sizeof(*instance->pd_info));
4135 memset(dcmd->mbox.b, 0, MFI_MBOX_SIZE);
4136
4137 dcmd->mbox.s[0] = cpu_to_le16(device_id);
4138 dcmd->cmd = MFI_CMD_DCMD;
4139 dcmd->cmd_status = 0xFF;
4140 dcmd->sge_count = 1;
4141 dcmd->flags = cpu_to_le16(MFI_FRAME_DIR_READ);
4142 dcmd->timeout = 0;
4143 dcmd->pad_0 = 0;
4144 dcmd->data_xfer_len = cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct MR_PD_INFO));
4145 dcmd->opcode = cpu_to_le32(MR_DCMD_PD_GET_INFO);
4146 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].phys_addr = cpu_to_le32(instance->pd_info_h);
4147 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].length = cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct MR_PD_INFO));
4148
4149 if ((instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES) &&
4150 !instance->mask_interrupts)
4151 ret = megasas_issue_blocked_cmd(instance, cmd, MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_SECS);
4152 else
4153 ret = megasas_issue_polled(instance, cmd);
4154
4155 switch (ret) {
4156 case DCMD_SUCCESS:
4157 mr_device_priv_data = sdev->hostdata;
4158 le16_to_cpus((u16 *)&instance->pd_info->state.ddf.pdType);
4159 mr_device_priv_data->interface_type =
4160 instance->pd_info->state.ddf.pdType.intf;
4161 break;
4162
4163 case DCMD_TIMEOUT:
4164
4165 switch (dcmd_timeout_ocr_possible(instance)) {
4166 case INITIATE_OCR:
4167 cmd->flags |= DRV_DCMD_SKIP_REFIRE;
4168 megasas_reset_fusion(instance->host,
4169 MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_OCR);
4170 break;
4171 case KILL_ADAPTER:
4172 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
4173 break;
4174 case IGNORE_TIMEOUT:
4175 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Ignore DCMD timeout: %s %d\n",
4176 __func__, __LINE__);
4177 break;
4178 }
4179
4180 break;
4181 }
4182
4183 if (ret != DCMD_TIMEOUT)
4184 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
4185
4186 return;
4187}
4188/*
4189 * megasas_get_pd_list_info - Returns FW's pd_list structure
4190 * @instance: Adapter soft state
4191 * @pd_list: pd_list structure
4192 *
4193 * Issues an internal command (DCMD) to get the FW's controller PD
4194 * list structure. This information is mainly used to find out SYSTEM
4195 * supported by the FW.
4196 */
4197static int
4198megasas_get_pd_list(struct megasas_instance *instance)
4199{
4200 int ret = 0, pd_index = 0;
4201 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
4202 struct megasas_dcmd_frame *dcmd;
4203 struct MR_PD_LIST *ci;
4204 struct MR_PD_ADDRESS *pd_addr;
4205 dma_addr_t ci_h = 0;
4206
4207 if (instance->pd_list_not_supported) {
4208 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "MR_DCMD_PD_LIST_QUERY "
4209 "not supported by firmware\n");
4210 return ret;
4211 }
4212
4213 cmd = megasas_get_cmd(instance);
4214
4215 if (!cmd) {
4216 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "(get_pd_list): Failed to get cmd\n");
4217 return -ENOMEM;
4218 }
4219
4220 dcmd = &cmd->frame->dcmd;
4221
4222 ci = pci_alloc_consistent(instance->pdev,
4223 MEGASAS_MAX_PD * sizeof(struct MR_PD_LIST), &ci_h);
4224
4225 if (!ci) {
4226 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to alloc mem for pd_list\n");
4227 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
4228 return -ENOMEM;
4229 }
4230
4231 memset(ci, 0, sizeof(*ci));
4232 memset(dcmd->mbox.b, 0, MFI_MBOX_SIZE);
4233
4234 dcmd->mbox.b[0] = MR_PD_QUERY_TYPE_EXPOSED_TO_HOST;
4235 dcmd->mbox.b[1] = 0;
4236 dcmd->cmd = MFI_CMD_DCMD;
4237 dcmd->cmd_status = MFI_STAT_INVALID_STATUS;
4238 dcmd->sge_count = 1;
4239 dcmd->flags = cpu_to_le16(MFI_FRAME_DIR_READ);
4240 dcmd->timeout = 0;
4241 dcmd->pad_0 = 0;
4242 dcmd->data_xfer_len = cpu_to_le32(MEGASAS_MAX_PD * sizeof(struct MR_PD_LIST));
4243 dcmd->opcode = cpu_to_le32(MR_DCMD_PD_LIST_QUERY);
4244 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].phys_addr = cpu_to_le32(ci_h);
4245 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].length = cpu_to_le32(MEGASAS_MAX_PD * sizeof(struct MR_PD_LIST));
4246
4247 if ((instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES) &&
4248 !instance->mask_interrupts)
4249 ret = megasas_issue_blocked_cmd(instance, cmd,
4250 MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_SECS);
4251 else
4252 ret = megasas_issue_polled(instance, cmd);
4253
4254 switch (ret) {
4255 case DCMD_FAILED:
4256 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "MR_DCMD_PD_LIST_QUERY "
4257 "failed/not supported by firmware\n");
4258
4259 if (instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES)
4260 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
4261 else
4262 instance->pd_list_not_supported = 1;
4263 break;
4264 case DCMD_TIMEOUT:
4265
4266 switch (dcmd_timeout_ocr_possible(instance)) {
4267 case INITIATE_OCR:
4268 cmd->flags |= DRV_DCMD_SKIP_REFIRE;
4269 /*
4270 * DCMD failed from AEN path.
4271 * AEN path already hold reset_mutex to avoid PCI access
4272 * while OCR is in progress.
4273 */
4274 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4275 megasas_reset_fusion(instance->host,
4276 MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_OCR);
4277 mutex_lock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4278 break;
4279 case KILL_ADAPTER:
4280 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
4281 break;
4282 case IGNORE_TIMEOUT:
4283 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Ignore DCMD timeout: %s %d \n",
4284 __func__, __LINE__);
4285 break;
4286 }
4287
4288 break;
4289
4290 case DCMD_SUCCESS:
4291 pd_addr = ci->addr;
4292
4293 if ((le32_to_cpu(ci->count) >
4294 (MEGASAS_MAX_PD_CHANNELS * MEGASAS_MAX_DEV_PER_CHANNEL)))
4295 break;
4296
4297 memset(instance->local_pd_list, 0,
4298 MEGASAS_MAX_PD * sizeof(struct megasas_pd_list));
4299
4300 for (pd_index = 0; pd_index < le32_to_cpu(ci->count); pd_index++) {
4301 instance->local_pd_list[le16_to_cpu(pd_addr->deviceId)].tid =
4302 le16_to_cpu(pd_addr->deviceId);
4303 instance->local_pd_list[le16_to_cpu(pd_addr->deviceId)].driveType =
4304 pd_addr->scsiDevType;
4305 instance->local_pd_list[le16_to_cpu(pd_addr->deviceId)].driveState =
4306 MR_PD_STATE_SYSTEM;
4307 pd_addr++;
4308 }
4309
4310 memcpy(instance->pd_list, instance->local_pd_list,
4311 sizeof(instance->pd_list));
4312 break;
4313
4314 }
4315
4316 pci_free_consistent(instance->pdev,
4317 MEGASAS_MAX_PD * sizeof(struct MR_PD_LIST),
4318 ci, ci_h);
4319
4320 if (ret != DCMD_TIMEOUT)
4321 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
4322
4323 return ret;
4324}
4325
4326/*
4327 * megasas_get_ld_list_info - Returns FW's ld_list structure
4328 * @instance: Adapter soft state
4329 * @ld_list: ld_list structure
4330 *
4331 * Issues an internal command (DCMD) to get the FW's controller PD
4332 * list structure. This information is mainly used to find out SYSTEM
4333 * supported by the FW.
4334 */
4335static int
4336megasas_get_ld_list(struct megasas_instance *instance)
4337{
4338 int ret = 0, ld_index = 0, ids = 0;
4339 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
4340 struct megasas_dcmd_frame *dcmd;
4341 struct MR_LD_LIST *ci;
4342 dma_addr_t ci_h = 0;
4343 u32 ld_count;
4344
4345 cmd = megasas_get_cmd(instance);
4346
4347 if (!cmd) {
4348 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "megasas_get_ld_list: Failed to get cmd\n");
4349 return -ENOMEM;
4350 }
4351
4352 dcmd = &cmd->frame->dcmd;
4353
4354 ci = pci_alloc_consistent(instance->pdev,
4355 sizeof(struct MR_LD_LIST),
4356 &ci_h);
4357
4358 if (!ci) {
4359 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to alloc mem in get_ld_list\n");
4360 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
4361 return -ENOMEM;
4362 }
4363
4364 memset(ci, 0, sizeof(*ci));
4365 memset(dcmd->mbox.b, 0, MFI_MBOX_SIZE);
4366
4367 if (instance->supportmax256vd)
4368 dcmd->mbox.b[0] = 1;
4369 dcmd->cmd = MFI_CMD_DCMD;
4370 dcmd->cmd_status = MFI_STAT_INVALID_STATUS;
4371 dcmd->sge_count = 1;
4372 dcmd->flags = cpu_to_le16(MFI_FRAME_DIR_READ);
4373 dcmd->timeout = 0;
4374 dcmd->data_xfer_len = cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct MR_LD_LIST));
4375 dcmd->opcode = cpu_to_le32(MR_DCMD_LD_GET_LIST);
4376 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].phys_addr = cpu_to_le32(ci_h);
4377 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].length = cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct MR_LD_LIST));
4378 dcmd->pad_0 = 0;
4379
4380 if ((instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES) &&
4381 !instance->mask_interrupts)
4382 ret = megasas_issue_blocked_cmd(instance, cmd,
4383 MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_SECS);
4384 else
4385 ret = megasas_issue_polled(instance, cmd);
4386
4387 ld_count = le32_to_cpu(ci->ldCount);
4388
4389 switch (ret) {
4390 case DCMD_FAILED:
4391 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
4392 break;
4393 case DCMD_TIMEOUT:
4394
4395 switch (dcmd_timeout_ocr_possible(instance)) {
4396 case INITIATE_OCR:
4397 cmd->flags |= DRV_DCMD_SKIP_REFIRE;
4398 /*
4399 * DCMD failed from AEN path.
4400 * AEN path already hold reset_mutex to avoid PCI access
4401 * while OCR is in progress.
4402 */
4403 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4404 megasas_reset_fusion(instance->host,
4405 MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_OCR);
4406 mutex_lock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4407 break;
4408 case KILL_ADAPTER:
4409 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
4410 break;
4411 case IGNORE_TIMEOUT:
4412 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Ignore DCMD timeout: %s %d\n",
4413 __func__, __LINE__);
4414 break;
4415 }
4416
4417 break;
4418
4419 case DCMD_SUCCESS:
4420 if (ld_count > instance->fw_supported_vd_count)
4421 break;
4422
4423 memset(instance->ld_ids, 0xff, MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES_EXT);
4424
4425 for (ld_index = 0; ld_index < ld_count; ld_index++) {
4426 if (ci->ldList[ld_index].state != 0) {
4427 ids = ci->ldList[ld_index].ref.targetId;
4428 instance->ld_ids[ids] = ci->ldList[ld_index].ref.targetId;
4429 }
4430 }
4431
4432 break;
4433 }
4434
4435 pci_free_consistent(instance->pdev, sizeof(struct MR_LD_LIST), ci, ci_h);
4436
4437 if (ret != DCMD_TIMEOUT)
4438 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
4439
4440 return ret;
4441}
4442
4443/**
4444 * megasas_ld_list_query - Returns FW's ld_list structure
4445 * @instance: Adapter soft state
4446 * @ld_list: ld_list structure
4447 *
4448 * Issues an internal command (DCMD) to get the FW's controller PD
4449 * list structure. This information is mainly used to find out SYSTEM
4450 * supported by the FW.
4451 */
4452static int
4453megasas_ld_list_query(struct megasas_instance *instance, u8 query_type)
4454{
4455 int ret = 0, ld_index = 0, ids = 0;
4456 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
4457 struct megasas_dcmd_frame *dcmd;
4458 struct MR_LD_TARGETID_LIST *ci;
4459 dma_addr_t ci_h = 0;
4460 u32 tgtid_count;
4461
4462 cmd = megasas_get_cmd(instance);
4463
4464 if (!cmd) {
4465 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev,
4466 "megasas_ld_list_query: Failed to get cmd\n");
4467 return -ENOMEM;
4468 }
4469
4470 dcmd = &cmd->frame->dcmd;
4471
4472 ci = pci_alloc_consistent(instance->pdev,
4473 sizeof(struct MR_LD_TARGETID_LIST), &ci_h);
4474
4475 if (!ci) {
4476 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev,
4477 "Failed to alloc mem for ld_list_query\n");
4478 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
4479 return -ENOMEM;
4480 }
4481
4482 memset(ci, 0, sizeof(*ci));
4483 memset(dcmd->mbox.b, 0, MFI_MBOX_SIZE);
4484
4485 dcmd->mbox.b[0] = query_type;
4486 if (instance->supportmax256vd)
4487 dcmd->mbox.b[2] = 1;
4488
4489 dcmd->cmd = MFI_CMD_DCMD;
4490 dcmd->cmd_status = MFI_STAT_INVALID_STATUS;
4491 dcmd->sge_count = 1;
4492 dcmd->flags = cpu_to_le16(MFI_FRAME_DIR_READ);
4493 dcmd->timeout = 0;
4494 dcmd->data_xfer_len = cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct MR_LD_TARGETID_LIST));
4495 dcmd->opcode = cpu_to_le32(MR_DCMD_LD_LIST_QUERY);
4496 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].phys_addr = cpu_to_le32(ci_h);
4497 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].length = cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct MR_LD_TARGETID_LIST));
4498 dcmd->pad_0 = 0;
4499
4500 if ((instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES) &&
4501 !instance->mask_interrupts)
4502 ret = megasas_issue_blocked_cmd(instance, cmd, MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_SECS);
4503 else
4504 ret = megasas_issue_polled(instance, cmd);
4505
4506 switch (ret) {
4507 case DCMD_FAILED:
4508 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
4509 "DCMD not supported by firmware - %s %d\n",
4510 __func__, __LINE__);
4511 ret = megasas_get_ld_list(instance);
4512 break;
4513 case DCMD_TIMEOUT:
4514 switch (dcmd_timeout_ocr_possible(instance)) {
4515 case INITIATE_OCR:
4516 cmd->flags |= DRV_DCMD_SKIP_REFIRE;
4517 /*
4518 * DCMD failed from AEN path.
4519 * AEN path already hold reset_mutex to avoid PCI access
4520 * while OCR is in progress.
4521 */
4522 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4523 megasas_reset_fusion(instance->host,
4524 MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_OCR);
4525 mutex_lock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4526 break;
4527 case KILL_ADAPTER:
4528 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
4529 break;
4530 case IGNORE_TIMEOUT:
4531 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Ignore DCMD timeout: %s %d\n",
4532 __func__, __LINE__);
4533 break;
4534 }
4535
4536 break;
4537 case DCMD_SUCCESS:
4538 tgtid_count = le32_to_cpu(ci->count);
4539
4540 if ((tgtid_count > (instance->fw_supported_vd_count)))
4541 break;
4542
4543 memset(instance->ld_ids, 0xff, MEGASAS_MAX_LD_IDS);
4544 for (ld_index = 0; ld_index < tgtid_count; ld_index++) {
4545 ids = ci->targetId[ld_index];
4546 instance->ld_ids[ids] = ci->targetId[ld_index];
4547 }
4548
4549 break;
4550 }
4551
4552 pci_free_consistent(instance->pdev, sizeof(struct MR_LD_TARGETID_LIST),
4553 ci, ci_h);
4554
4555 if (ret != DCMD_TIMEOUT)
4556 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
4557
4558 return ret;
4559}
4560
4561/*
4562 * megasas_update_ext_vd_details : Update details w.r.t Extended VD
4563 * instance : Controller's instance
4564*/
4565static void megasas_update_ext_vd_details(struct megasas_instance *instance)
4566{
4567 struct fusion_context *fusion;
4568 u32 ventura_map_sz = 0;
4569
4570 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
4571 /* For MFI based controllers return dummy success */
4572 if (!fusion)
4573 return;
4574
4575 instance->supportmax256vd =
4576 instance->ctrl_info->adapterOperations3.supportMaxExtLDs;
4577 /* Below is additional check to address future FW enhancement */
4578 if (instance->ctrl_info->max_lds > 64)
4579 instance->supportmax256vd = 1;
4580
4581 instance->drv_supported_vd_count = MEGASAS_MAX_LD_CHANNELS
4582 * MEGASAS_MAX_DEV_PER_CHANNEL;
4583 instance->drv_supported_pd_count = MEGASAS_MAX_PD_CHANNELS
4584 * MEGASAS_MAX_DEV_PER_CHANNEL;
4585 if (instance->supportmax256vd) {
4586 instance->fw_supported_vd_count = MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES_EXT;
4587 instance->fw_supported_pd_count = MAX_PHYSICAL_DEVICES;
4588 } else {
4589 instance->fw_supported_vd_count = MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES;
4590 instance->fw_supported_pd_count = MAX_PHYSICAL_DEVICES;
4591 }
4592
4593 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
4594 "firmware type\t: %s\n",
4595 instance->supportmax256vd ? "Extended VD(240 VD)firmware" :
4596 "Legacy(64 VD) firmware");
4597
4598 if (instance->max_raid_mapsize) {
4599 ventura_map_sz = instance->max_raid_mapsize *
4600 MR_MIN_MAP_SIZE; /* 64k */
4601 fusion->current_map_sz = ventura_map_sz;
4602 fusion->max_map_sz = ventura_map_sz;
4603 } else {
4604 fusion->old_map_sz = sizeof(struct MR_FW_RAID_MAP) +
4605 (sizeof(struct MR_LD_SPAN_MAP) *
4606 (instance->fw_supported_vd_count - 1));
4607 fusion->new_map_sz = sizeof(struct MR_FW_RAID_MAP_EXT);
4608
4609 fusion->max_map_sz =
4610 max(fusion->old_map_sz, fusion->new_map_sz);
4611
4612 if (instance->supportmax256vd)
4613 fusion->current_map_sz = fusion->new_map_sz;
4614 else
4615 fusion->current_map_sz = fusion->old_map_sz;
4616 }
4617 /* irrespective of FW raid maps, driver raid map is constant */
4618 fusion->drv_map_sz = sizeof(struct MR_DRV_RAID_MAP_ALL);
4619}
4620
4621/**
4622 * megasas_get_controller_info - Returns FW's controller structure
4623 * @instance: Adapter soft state
4624 *
4625 * Issues an internal command (DCMD) to get the FW's controller structure.
4626 * This information is mainly used to find out the maximum IO transfer per
4627 * command supported by the FW.
4628 */
4629int
4630megasas_get_ctrl_info(struct megasas_instance *instance)
4631{
4632 int ret = 0;
4633 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
4634 struct megasas_dcmd_frame *dcmd;
4635 struct megasas_ctrl_info *ci;
4636 struct megasas_ctrl_info *ctrl_info;
4637 dma_addr_t ci_h = 0;
4638
4639 ctrl_info = instance->ctrl_info;
4640
4641 cmd = megasas_get_cmd(instance);
4642
4643 if (!cmd) {
4644 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to get a free cmd\n");
4645 return -ENOMEM;
4646 }
4647
4648 dcmd = &cmd->frame->dcmd;
4649
4650 ci = pci_alloc_consistent(instance->pdev,
4651 sizeof(struct megasas_ctrl_info), &ci_h);
4652
4653 if (!ci) {
4654 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to alloc mem for ctrl info\n");
4655 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
4656 return -ENOMEM;
4657 }
4658
4659 memset(ci, 0, sizeof(*ci));
4660 memset(dcmd->mbox.b, 0, MFI_MBOX_SIZE);
4661
4662 dcmd->cmd = MFI_CMD_DCMD;
4663 dcmd->cmd_status = MFI_STAT_INVALID_STATUS;
4664 dcmd->sge_count = 1;
4665 dcmd->flags = cpu_to_le16(MFI_FRAME_DIR_READ);
4666 dcmd->timeout = 0;
4667 dcmd->pad_0 = 0;
4668 dcmd->data_xfer_len = cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct megasas_ctrl_info));
4669 dcmd->opcode = cpu_to_le32(MR_DCMD_CTRL_GET_INFO);
4670 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].phys_addr = cpu_to_le32(ci_h);
4671 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].length = cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct megasas_ctrl_info));
4672 dcmd->mbox.b[0] = 1;
4673
4674 if ((instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES) &&
4675 !instance->mask_interrupts)
4676 ret = megasas_issue_blocked_cmd(instance, cmd, MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_SECS);
4677 else
4678 ret = megasas_issue_polled(instance, cmd);
4679
4680 switch (ret) {
4681 case DCMD_SUCCESS:
4682 memcpy(ctrl_info, ci, sizeof(struct megasas_ctrl_info));
4683 /* Save required controller information in
4684 * CPU endianness format.
4685 */
4686 le32_to_cpus((u32 *)&ctrl_info->properties.OnOffProperties);
4687 le32_to_cpus((u32 *)&ctrl_info->adapterOperations2);
4688 le32_to_cpus((u32 *)&ctrl_info->adapterOperations3);
4689 le16_to_cpus((u16 *)&ctrl_info->adapter_operations4);
4690
4691 /* Update the latest Ext VD info.
4692 * From Init path, store current firmware details.
4693 * From OCR path, detect any firmware properties changes.
4694 * in case of Firmware upgrade without system reboot.
4695 */
4696 megasas_update_ext_vd_details(instance);
4697 instance->use_seqnum_jbod_fp =
4698 ctrl_info->adapterOperations3.useSeqNumJbodFP;
4699 instance->support_morethan256jbod =
4700 ctrl_info->adapter_operations4.support_pd_map_target_id;
4701
4702 /*Check whether controller is iMR or MR */
4703 instance->is_imr = (ctrl_info->memory_size ? 0 : 1);
4704 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
4705 "controller type\t: %s(%dMB)\n",
4706 instance->is_imr ? "iMR" : "MR",
4707 le16_to_cpu(ctrl_info->memory_size));
4708
4709 instance->disableOnlineCtrlReset =
4710 ctrl_info->properties.OnOffProperties.disableOnlineCtrlReset;
4711 instance->secure_jbod_support =
4712 ctrl_info->adapterOperations3.supportSecurityonJBOD;
4713 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Online Controller Reset(OCR)\t: %s\n",
4714 instance->disableOnlineCtrlReset ? "Disabled" : "Enabled");
4715 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Secure JBOD support\t: %s\n",
4716 instance->secure_jbod_support ? "Yes" : "No");
4717 break;
4718
4719 case DCMD_TIMEOUT:
4720 switch (dcmd_timeout_ocr_possible(instance)) {
4721 case INITIATE_OCR:
4722 cmd->flags |= DRV_DCMD_SKIP_REFIRE;
4723 megasas_reset_fusion(instance->host,
4724 MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_OCR);
4725 break;
4726 case KILL_ADAPTER:
4727 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
4728 break;
4729 case IGNORE_TIMEOUT:
4730 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Ignore DCMD timeout: %s %d\n",
4731 __func__, __LINE__);
4732 break;
4733 }
4734 case DCMD_FAILED:
4735 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
4736 break;
4737
4738 }
4739
4740 pci_free_consistent(instance->pdev, sizeof(struct megasas_ctrl_info),
4741 ci, ci_h);
4742
4743 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
4744
4745
4746 return ret;
4747}
4748
4749/*
4750 * megasas_set_crash_dump_params - Sends address of crash dump DMA buffer
4751 * to firmware
4752 *
4753 * @instance: Adapter soft state
4754 * @crash_buf_state - tell FW to turn ON/OFF crash dump feature
4755 MR_CRASH_BUF_TURN_OFF = 0
4756 MR_CRASH_BUF_TURN_ON = 1
4757 * @return 0 on success non-zero on failure.
4758 * Issues an internal command (DCMD) to set parameters for crash dump feature.
4759 * Driver will send address of crash dump DMA buffer and set mbox to tell FW
4760 * that driver supports crash dump feature. This DCMD will be sent only if
4761 * crash dump feature is supported by the FW.
4762 *
4763 */
4764int megasas_set_crash_dump_params(struct megasas_instance *instance,
4765 u8 crash_buf_state)
4766{
4767 int ret = 0;
4768 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
4769 struct megasas_dcmd_frame *dcmd;
4770
4771 cmd = megasas_get_cmd(instance);
4772
4773 if (!cmd) {
4774 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to get a free cmd\n");
4775 return -ENOMEM;
4776 }
4777
4778
4779 dcmd = &cmd->frame->dcmd;
4780
4781 memset(dcmd->mbox.b, 0, MFI_MBOX_SIZE);
4782 dcmd->mbox.b[0] = crash_buf_state;
4783 dcmd->cmd = MFI_CMD_DCMD;
4784 dcmd->cmd_status = MFI_STAT_INVALID_STATUS;
4785 dcmd->sge_count = 1;
4786 dcmd->flags = cpu_to_le16(MFI_FRAME_DIR_NONE);
4787 dcmd->timeout = 0;
4788 dcmd->pad_0 = 0;
4789 dcmd->data_xfer_len = cpu_to_le32(CRASH_DMA_BUF_SIZE);
4790 dcmd->opcode = cpu_to_le32(MR_DCMD_CTRL_SET_CRASH_DUMP_PARAMS);
4791 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].phys_addr = cpu_to_le32(instance->crash_dump_h);
4792 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].length = cpu_to_le32(CRASH_DMA_BUF_SIZE);
4793
4794 if ((instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES) &&
4795 !instance->mask_interrupts)
4796 ret = megasas_issue_blocked_cmd(instance, cmd, MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_SECS);
4797 else
4798 ret = megasas_issue_polled(instance, cmd);
4799
4800 if (ret == DCMD_TIMEOUT) {
4801 switch (dcmd_timeout_ocr_possible(instance)) {
4802 case INITIATE_OCR:
4803 cmd->flags |= DRV_DCMD_SKIP_REFIRE;
4804 megasas_reset_fusion(instance->host,
4805 MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_OCR);
4806 break;
4807 case KILL_ADAPTER:
4808 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
4809 break;
4810 case IGNORE_TIMEOUT:
4811 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Ignore DCMD timeout: %s %d\n",
4812 __func__, __LINE__);
4813 break;
4814 }
4815 } else
4816 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
4817
4818 return ret;
4819}
4820
4821/**
4822 * megasas_issue_init_mfi - Initializes the FW
4823 * @instance: Adapter soft state
4824 *
4825 * Issues the INIT MFI cmd
4826 */
4827static int
4828megasas_issue_init_mfi(struct megasas_instance *instance)
4829{
4830 __le32 context;
4831 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
4832 struct megasas_init_frame *init_frame;
4833 struct megasas_init_queue_info *initq_info;
4834 dma_addr_t init_frame_h;
4835 dma_addr_t initq_info_h;
4836
4837 /*
4838 * Prepare a init frame. Note the init frame points to queue info
4839 * structure. Each frame has SGL allocated after first 64 bytes. For
4840 * this frame - since we don't need any SGL - we use SGL's space as
4841 * queue info structure
4842 *
4843 * We will not get a NULL command below. We just created the pool.
4844 */
4845 cmd = megasas_get_cmd(instance);
4846
4847 init_frame = (struct megasas_init_frame *)cmd->frame;
4848 initq_info = (struct megasas_init_queue_info *)
4849 ((unsigned long)init_frame + 64);
4850
4851 init_frame_h = cmd->frame_phys_addr;
4852 initq_info_h = init_frame_h + 64;
4853
4854 context = init_frame->context;
4855 memset(init_frame, 0, MEGAMFI_FRAME_SIZE);
4856 memset(initq_info, 0, sizeof(struct megasas_init_queue_info));
4857 init_frame->context = context;
4858
4859 initq_info->reply_queue_entries = cpu_to_le32(instance->max_fw_cmds + 1);
4860 initq_info->reply_queue_start_phys_addr_lo = cpu_to_le32(instance->reply_queue_h);
4861
4862 initq_info->producer_index_phys_addr_lo = cpu_to_le32(instance->producer_h);
4863 initq_info->consumer_index_phys_addr_lo = cpu_to_le32(instance->consumer_h);
4864
4865 init_frame->cmd = MFI_CMD_INIT;
4866 init_frame->cmd_status = MFI_STAT_INVALID_STATUS;
4867 init_frame->queue_info_new_phys_addr_lo =
4868 cpu_to_le32(lower_32_bits(initq_info_h));
4869 init_frame->queue_info_new_phys_addr_hi =
4870 cpu_to_le32(upper_32_bits(initq_info_h));
4871
4872 init_frame->data_xfer_len = cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct megasas_init_queue_info));
4873
4874 /*
4875 * disable the intr before firing the init frame to FW
4876 */
4877 instance->instancet->disable_intr(instance);
4878
4879 /*
4880 * Issue the init frame in polled mode
4881 */
4882
4883 if (megasas_issue_polled(instance, cmd)) {
4884 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to init firmware\n");
4885 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
4886 goto fail_fw_init;
4887 }
4888
4889 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
4890
4891 return 0;
4892
4893fail_fw_init:
4894 return -EINVAL;
4895}
4896
4897static u32
4898megasas_init_adapter_mfi(struct megasas_instance *instance)
4899{
4900 struct megasas_register_set __iomem *reg_set;
4901 u32 context_sz;
4902 u32 reply_q_sz;
4903
4904 reg_set = instance->reg_set;
4905
4906 /*
4907 * Get various operational parameters from status register
4908 */
4909 instance->max_fw_cmds = instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg(reg_set) & 0x00FFFF;
4910 /*
4911 * Reduce the max supported cmds by 1. This is to ensure that the
4912 * reply_q_sz (1 more than the max cmd that driver may send)
4913 * does not exceed max cmds that the FW can support
4914 */
4915 instance->max_fw_cmds = instance->max_fw_cmds-1;
4916 instance->max_mfi_cmds = instance->max_fw_cmds;
4917 instance->max_num_sge = (instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg(reg_set) & 0xFF0000) >>
4918 0x10;
4919 /*
4920 * For MFI skinny adapters, MEGASAS_SKINNY_INT_CMDS commands
4921 * are reserved for IOCTL + driver's internal DCMDs.
4922 */
4923 if ((instance->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS0073SKINNY) ||
4924 (instance->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS0071SKINNY)) {
4925 instance->max_scsi_cmds = (instance->max_fw_cmds -
4926 MEGASAS_SKINNY_INT_CMDS);
4927 sema_init(&instance->ioctl_sem, MEGASAS_SKINNY_INT_CMDS);
4928 } else {
4929 instance->max_scsi_cmds = (instance->max_fw_cmds -
4930 MEGASAS_INT_CMDS);
4931 sema_init(&instance->ioctl_sem, (MEGASAS_MFI_IOCTL_CMDS));
4932 }
4933
4934 instance->cur_can_queue = instance->max_scsi_cmds;
4935 /*
4936 * Create a pool of commands
4937 */
4938 if (megasas_alloc_cmds(instance))
4939 goto fail_alloc_cmds;
4940
4941 /*
4942 * Allocate memory for reply queue. Length of reply queue should
4943 * be _one_ more than the maximum commands handled by the firmware.
4944 *
4945 * Note: When FW completes commands, it places corresponding contex
4946 * values in this circular reply queue. This circular queue is a fairly
4947 * typical producer-consumer queue. FW is the producer (of completed
4948 * commands) and the driver is the consumer.
4949 */
4950 context_sz = sizeof(u32);
4951 reply_q_sz = context_sz * (instance->max_fw_cmds + 1);
4952
4953 instance->reply_queue = pci_alloc_consistent(instance->pdev,
4954 reply_q_sz,
4955 &instance->reply_queue_h);
4956
4957 if (!instance->reply_queue) {
4958 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "Out of DMA mem for reply queue\n");
4959 goto fail_reply_queue;
4960 }
4961
4962 if (megasas_issue_init_mfi(instance))
4963 goto fail_fw_init;
4964
4965 if (megasas_get_ctrl_info(instance)) {
4966 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "(%d): Could get controller info "
4967 "Fail from %s %d\n", instance->unique_id,
4968 __func__, __LINE__);
4969 goto fail_fw_init;
4970 }
4971
4972 instance->fw_support_ieee = 0;
4973 instance->fw_support_ieee =
4974 (instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg(reg_set) &
4975 0x04000000);
4976
4977 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "megasas_init_mfi: fw_support_ieee=%d",
4978 instance->fw_support_ieee);
4979
4980 if (instance->fw_support_ieee)
4981 instance->flag_ieee = 1;
4982
4983 return 0;
4984
4985fail_fw_init:
4986
4987 pci_free_consistent(instance->pdev, reply_q_sz,
4988 instance->reply_queue, instance->reply_queue_h);
4989fail_reply_queue:
4990 megasas_free_cmds(instance);
4991
4992fail_alloc_cmds:
4993 return 1;
4994}
4995
4996/*
4997 * megasas_setup_irqs_ioapic - register legacy interrupts.
4998 * @instance: Adapter soft state
4999 *
5000 * Do not enable interrupt, only setup ISRs.
5001 *
5002 * Return 0 on success.
5003 */
5004static int
5005megasas_setup_irqs_ioapic(struct megasas_instance *instance)
5006{
5007 struct pci_dev *pdev;
5008
5009 pdev = instance->pdev;
5010 instance->irq_context[0].instance = instance;
5011 instance->irq_context[0].MSIxIndex = 0;
5012 if (request_irq(pci_irq_vector(pdev, 0),
5013 instance->instancet->service_isr, IRQF_SHARED,
5014 "megasas", &instance->irq_context[0])) {
5015 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
5016 "Failed to register IRQ from %s %d\n",
5017 __func__, __LINE__);
5018 return -1;
5019 }
5020 return 0;
5021}
5022
5023/**
5024 * megasas_setup_irqs_msix - register MSI-x interrupts.
5025 * @instance: Adapter soft state
5026 * @is_probe: Driver probe check
5027 *
5028 * Do not enable interrupt, only setup ISRs.
5029 *
5030 * Return 0 on success.
5031 */
5032static int
5033megasas_setup_irqs_msix(struct megasas_instance *instance, u8 is_probe)
5034{
5035 int i, j;
5036 struct pci_dev *pdev;
5037
5038 pdev = instance->pdev;
5039
5040 /* Try MSI-x */
5041 for (i = 0; i < instance->msix_vectors; i++) {
5042 instance->irq_context[i].instance = instance;
5043 instance->irq_context[i].MSIxIndex = i;
5044 if (request_irq(pci_irq_vector(pdev, i),
5045 instance->instancet->service_isr, 0, "megasas",
5046 &instance->irq_context[i])) {
5047 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
5048 "Failed to register IRQ for vector %d.\n", i);
5049 for (j = 0; j < i; j++)
5050 free_irq(pci_irq_vector(pdev, j),
5051 &instance->irq_context[j]);
5052 /* Retry irq register for IO_APIC*/
5053 instance->msix_vectors = 0;
5054 if (is_probe) {
5055 pci_free_irq_vectors(instance->pdev);
5056 return megasas_setup_irqs_ioapic(instance);
5057 } else {
5058 return -1;
5059 }
5060 }
5061 }
5062 return 0;
5063}
5064
5065/*
5066 * megasas_destroy_irqs- unregister interrupts.
5067 * @instance: Adapter soft state
5068 * return: void
5069 */
5070static void
5071megasas_destroy_irqs(struct megasas_instance *instance) {
5072
5073 int i;
5074
5075 if (instance->msix_vectors)
5076 for (i = 0; i < instance->msix_vectors; i++) {
5077 free_irq(pci_irq_vector(instance->pdev, i),
5078 &instance->irq_context[i]);
5079 }
5080 else
5081 free_irq(pci_irq_vector(instance->pdev, 0),
5082 &instance->irq_context[0]);
5083}
5084
5085/**
5086 * megasas_setup_jbod_map - setup jbod map for FP seq_number.
5087 * @instance: Adapter soft state
5088 * @is_probe: Driver probe check
5089 *
5090 * Return 0 on success.
5091 */
5092void
5093megasas_setup_jbod_map(struct megasas_instance *instance)
5094{
5095 int i;
5096 struct fusion_context *fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
5097 u32 pd_seq_map_sz;
5098
5099 pd_seq_map_sz = sizeof(struct MR_PD_CFG_SEQ_NUM_SYNC) +
5100 (sizeof(struct MR_PD_CFG_SEQ) * (MAX_PHYSICAL_DEVICES - 1));
5101
5102 if (reset_devices || !fusion ||
5103 !instance->ctrl_info->adapterOperations3.useSeqNumJbodFP) {
5104 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
5105 "Jbod map is not supported %s %d\n",
5106 __func__, __LINE__);
5107 instance->use_seqnum_jbod_fp = false;
5108 return;
5109 }
5110
5111 if (fusion->pd_seq_sync[0])
5112 goto skip_alloc;
5113
5114 for (i = 0; i < JBOD_MAPS_COUNT; i++) {
5115 fusion->pd_seq_sync[i] = dma_alloc_coherent
5116 (&instance->pdev->dev, pd_seq_map_sz,
5117 &fusion->pd_seq_phys[i], GFP_KERNEL);
5118 if (!fusion->pd_seq_sync[i]) {
5119 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
5120 "Failed to allocate memory from %s %d\n",
5121 __func__, __LINE__);
5122 if (i == 1) {
5123 dma_free_coherent(&instance->pdev->dev,
5124 pd_seq_map_sz, fusion->pd_seq_sync[0],
5125 fusion->pd_seq_phys[0]);
5126 fusion->pd_seq_sync[0] = NULL;
5127 }
5128 instance->use_seqnum_jbod_fp = false;
5129 return;
5130 }
5131 }
5132
5133skip_alloc:
5134 if (!megasas_sync_pd_seq_num(instance, false) &&
5135 !megasas_sync_pd_seq_num(instance, true))
5136 instance->use_seqnum_jbod_fp = true;
5137 else
5138 instance->use_seqnum_jbod_fp = false;
5139}
5140
5141static void megasas_setup_reply_map(struct megasas_instance *instance)
5142{
5143 const struct cpumask *mask;
5144 unsigned int queue, cpu;
5145
5146 for (queue = 0; queue < instance->msix_vectors; queue++) {
5147 mask = pci_irq_get_affinity(instance->pdev, queue);
5148 if (!mask)
5149 goto fallback;
5150
5151 for_each_cpu(cpu, mask)
5152 instance->reply_map[cpu] = queue;
5153 }
5154 return;
5155
5156fallback:
5157 for_each_possible_cpu(cpu)
5158 instance->reply_map[cpu] = cpu % instance->msix_vectors;
5159}
5160
5161/**
5162 * megasas_init_fw - Initializes the FW
5163 * @instance: Adapter soft state
5164 *
5165 * This is the main function for initializing firmware
5166 */
5167
5168static int megasas_init_fw(struct megasas_instance *instance)
5169{
5170 u32 max_sectors_1;
5171 u32 max_sectors_2, tmp_sectors, msix_enable;
5172 u32 scratch_pad_2, scratch_pad_3, scratch_pad_4;
5173 resource_size_t base_addr;
5174 struct megasas_register_set __iomem *reg_set;
5175 struct megasas_ctrl_info *ctrl_info = NULL;
5176 unsigned long bar_list;
5177 int i, j, loop, fw_msix_count = 0;
5178 struct IOV_111 *iovPtr;
5179 struct fusion_context *fusion;
5180
5181 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
5182
5183 /* Find first memory bar */
5184 bar_list = pci_select_bars(instance->pdev, IORESOURCE_MEM);
5185 instance->bar = find_first_bit(&bar_list, BITS_PER_LONG);
5186 if (pci_request_selected_regions(instance->pdev, 1<<instance->bar,
5187 "megasas: LSI")) {
5188 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "IO memory region busy!\n");
5189 return -EBUSY;
5190 }
5191
5192 base_addr = pci_resource_start(instance->pdev, instance->bar);
5193 instance->reg_set = ioremap_nocache(base_addr, 8192);
5194
5195 if (!instance->reg_set) {
5196 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to map IO mem\n");
5197 goto fail_ioremap;
5198 }
5199
5200 reg_set = instance->reg_set;
5201
5202 if (instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES)
5203 instance->instancet = &megasas_instance_template_fusion;
5204 else {
5205 switch (instance->pdev->device) {
5206 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS1078R:
5207 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS1078DE:
5208 instance->instancet = &megasas_instance_template_ppc;
5209 break;
5210 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS1078GEN2:
5211 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS0079GEN2:
5212 instance->instancet = &megasas_instance_template_gen2;
5213 break;
5214 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS0073SKINNY:
5215 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS0071SKINNY:
5216 instance->instancet = &megasas_instance_template_skinny;
5217 break;
5218 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS1064R:
5219 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_DELL_PERC5:
5220 default:
5221 instance->instancet = &megasas_instance_template_xscale;
5222 instance->pd_list_not_supported = 1;
5223 break;
5224 }
5225 }
5226
5227 if (megasas_transition_to_ready(instance, 0)) {
5228 atomic_set(&instance->fw_reset_no_pci_access, 1);
5229 instance->instancet->adp_reset
5230 (instance, instance->reg_set);
5231 atomic_set(&instance->fw_reset_no_pci_access, 0);
5232 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
5233 "FW restarted successfully from %s!\n",
5234 __func__);
5235
5236 /*waitting for about 30 second before retry*/
5237 ssleep(30);
