5238
5239 if (megasas_transition_to_ready(instance, 0))
5240 goto fail_ready_state;
5241 }
5242
5243 if (instance->adapter_type == VENTURA_SERIES) {
5244 scratch_pad_3 =
5245 readl(&instance->reg_set->outbound_scratch_pad_3);
5246 instance->max_raid_mapsize = ((scratch_pad_3 >>
5247 MR_MAX_RAID_MAP_SIZE_OFFSET_SHIFT) &
5248 MR_MAX_RAID_MAP_SIZE_MASK);
5249 }
5250
5251 /* Check if MSI-X is supported while in ready state */
5252 msix_enable = (instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg(reg_set) &
5253 0x4000000) >> 0x1a;
5254 if (msix_enable && !msix_disable) {
5255 int irq_flags = PCI_IRQ_MSIX;
5256
5257 scratch_pad_2 = readl
5258 (&instance->reg_set->outbound_scratch_pad_2);
5259 /* Check max MSI-X vectors */
5260 if (fusion) {
5261 if (instance->adapter_type == THUNDERBOLT_SERIES) {
5262 /* Thunderbolt Series*/
5263 instance->msix_vectors = (scratch_pad_2
5264 & MR_MAX_REPLY_QUEUES_OFFSET) + 1;
5265 fw_msix_count = instance->msix_vectors;
5266 } else { /* Invader series supports more than 8 MSI-x vectors*/
5267 instance->msix_vectors = ((scratch_pad_2
5268 & MR_MAX_REPLY_QUEUES_EXT_OFFSET)
5269 >> MR_MAX_REPLY_QUEUES_EXT_OFFSET_SHIFT) + 1;
5270 if (instance->msix_vectors > 16)
5271 instance->msix_combined = true;
5272
5273 if (rdpq_enable)
5274 instance->is_rdpq = (scratch_pad_2 & MR_RDPQ_MODE_OFFSET) ?
5275 1 : 0;
5276 fw_msix_count = instance->msix_vectors;
5277 /* Save 1-15 reply post index address to local memory
5278 * Index 0 is already saved from reg offset
5279 * MPI2_REPLY_POST_HOST_INDEX_OFFSET
5280 */
5281 for (loop = 1; loop < MR_MAX_MSIX_REG_ARRAY; loop++) {
5282 instance->reply_post_host_index_addr[loop] =
5283 (u32 __iomem *)
5284 ((u8 __iomem *)instance->reg_set +
5285 MPI2_SUP_REPLY_POST_HOST_INDEX_OFFSET
5286 + (loop * 0x10));
5287 }
5288 }
5289 if (msix_vectors)
5290 instance->msix_vectors = min(msix_vectors,
5291 instance->msix_vectors);
5292 } else /* MFI adapters */
5293 instance->msix_vectors = 1;
5294 /* Don't bother allocating more MSI-X vectors than cpus */
5295 instance->msix_vectors = min(instance->msix_vectors,
5296 (unsigned int)num_online_cpus());
5297 if (smp_affinity_enable)
5298 irq_flags |= PCI_IRQ_AFFINITY;
5299 i = pci_alloc_irq_vectors(instance->pdev, 1,
5300 instance->msix_vectors, irq_flags);
5301 if (i > 0)
5302 instance->msix_vectors = i;
5303 else
5304 instance->msix_vectors = 0;
5305 }
5306 /*
5307 * MSI-X host index 0 is common for all adapter.
5308 * It is used for all MPT based Adapters.
5309 */
5310 if (instance->msix_combined) {
5311 instance->reply_post_host_index_addr[0] =
5312 (u32 *)((u8 *)instance->reg_set +
5313 MPI2_SUP_REPLY_POST_HOST_INDEX_OFFSET);
5314 } else {
5315 instance->reply_post_host_index_addr[0] =
5316 (u32 *)((u8 *)instance->reg_set +
5317 MPI2_REPLY_POST_HOST_INDEX_OFFSET);
5318 }
5319
5320 if (!instance->msix_vectors) {
5321 i = pci_alloc_irq_vectors(instance->pdev, 1, 1, PCI_IRQ_LEGACY);
5322 if (i < 0)
5323 goto fail_setup_irqs;
5324 }
5325
5326 megasas_setup_reply_map(instance);
5327
5328 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
5329 "firmware supports msix\t: (%d)", fw_msix_count);
5330 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
5331 "current msix/online cpus\t: (%d/%d)\n",
5332 instance->msix_vectors, (unsigned int)num_online_cpus());
5333 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
5334 "RDPQ mode\t: (%s)\n", instance->is_rdpq ? "enabled" : "disabled");
5335
5336 tasklet_init(&instance->isr_tasklet, instance->instancet->tasklet,
5337 (unsigned long)instance);
5338
5339 instance->ctrl_info = kzalloc(sizeof(struct megasas_ctrl_info),
5340 GFP_KERNEL);
5341 if (instance->ctrl_info == NULL)
5342 goto fail_init_adapter;
5343
5344 /*
5345 * Below are default value for legacy Firmware.
5346 * non-fusion based controllers
5347 */
5348 instance->fw_supported_vd_count = MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES;
5349 instance->fw_supported_pd_count = MAX_PHYSICAL_DEVICES;
5350 /* Get operational params, sge flags, send init cmd to controller */
5351 if (instance->instancet->init_adapter(instance))
5352 goto fail_init_adapter;
5353
5354 if (instance->adapter_type == VENTURA_SERIES) {
5355 scratch_pad_4 =
5356 readl(&instance->reg_set->outbound_scratch_pad_4);
5357 if ((scratch_pad_4 & MR_NVME_PAGE_SIZE_MASK) >=
5358 MR_DEFAULT_NVME_PAGE_SHIFT)
5359 instance->nvme_page_size =
5360 (1 << (scratch_pad_4 & MR_NVME_PAGE_SIZE_MASK));
5361
5362 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
5363 "NVME page size\t: (%d)\n", instance->nvme_page_size);
5364 }
5365
5366 if (instance->msix_vectors ?
5367 megasas_setup_irqs_msix(instance, 1) :
5368 megasas_setup_irqs_ioapic(instance))
5369 goto fail_init_adapter;
5370
5371 instance->instancet->enable_intr(instance);
5372
5373 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "INIT adapter done\n");
5374
5375 megasas_setup_jbod_map(instance);
5376
5377 /** for passthrough
5378 * the following function will get the PD LIST.
5379 */
5380 memset(instance->pd_list, 0,
5381 (MEGASAS_MAX_PD * sizeof(struct megasas_pd_list)));
5382 if (megasas_get_pd_list(instance) < 0) {
5383 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "failed to get PD list\n");
5384 goto fail_get_ld_pd_list;
5385 }
5386
5387 memset(instance->ld_ids, 0xff, MEGASAS_MAX_LD_IDS);
5388
5389 /* stream detection initialization */
5390 if (instance->adapter_type == VENTURA_SERIES) {
5391 fusion->stream_detect_by_ld =
5392 kzalloc(sizeof(struct LD_STREAM_DETECT *)
5393 * MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES_EXT,
5394 GFP_KERNEL);
5395 if (!fusion->stream_detect_by_ld) {
5396 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
5397 "unable to allocate stream detection for pool of LDs\n");
5398 goto fail_get_ld_pd_list;
5399 }
5400 for (i = 0; i < MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES_EXT; ++i) {
5401 fusion->stream_detect_by_ld[i] =
5402 kmalloc(sizeof(struct LD_STREAM_DETECT),
5403 GFP_KERNEL);
5404 if (!fusion->stream_detect_by_ld[i]) {
5405 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
5406 "unable to allocate stream detect by LD\n ");
5407 for (j = 0; j < i; ++j)
5408 kfree(fusion->stream_detect_by_ld[j]);
5409 kfree(fusion->stream_detect_by_ld);
5410 fusion->stream_detect_by_ld = NULL;
5411 goto fail_get_ld_pd_list;
5412 }
5413 fusion->stream_detect_by_ld[i]->mru_bit_map
5414 = MR_STREAM_BITMAP;
5415 }
5416 }
5417
5418 if (megasas_ld_list_query(instance,
5419 MR_LD_QUERY_TYPE_EXPOSED_TO_HOST))
5420 goto fail_get_ld_pd_list;
5421
5422 /*
5423 * Compute the max allowed sectors per IO: The controller info has two
5424 * limits on max sectors. Driver should use the minimum of these two.
5425 *
5426 * 1 << stripe_sz_ops.min = max sectors per strip
5427 *
5428 * Note that older firmwares ( < FW ver 30) didn't report information
5429 * to calculate max_sectors_1. So the number ended up as zero always.
5430 */
5431 tmp_sectors = 0;
5432 ctrl_info = instance->ctrl_info;
5433
5434 max_sectors_1 = (1 << ctrl_info->stripe_sz_ops.min) *
5435 le16_to_cpu(ctrl_info->max_strips_per_io);
5436 max_sectors_2 = le32_to_cpu(ctrl_info->max_request_size);
5437
5438 tmp_sectors = min_t(u32, max_sectors_1, max_sectors_2);
5439
5440 instance->peerIsPresent = ctrl_info->cluster.peerIsPresent;
5441 instance->passive = ctrl_info->cluster.passive;
5442 memcpy(instance->clusterId, ctrl_info->clusterId, sizeof(instance->clusterId));
5443 instance->UnevenSpanSupport =
5444 ctrl_info->adapterOperations2.supportUnevenSpans;
5445 if (instance->UnevenSpanSupport) {
5446 struct fusion_context *fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
5447 if (MR_ValidateMapInfo(instance))
5448 fusion->fast_path_io = 1;
5449 else
5450 fusion->fast_path_io = 0;
5451
5452 }
5453 if (ctrl_info->host_interface.SRIOV) {
5454 instance->requestorId = ctrl_info->iov.requestorId;
5455 if (instance->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_PLASMA) {
5456 if (!ctrl_info->adapterOperations2.activePassive)
5457 instance->PlasmaFW111 = 1;
5458
5459 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "SR-IOV: firmware type: %s\n",
5460 instance->PlasmaFW111 ? "1.11" : "new");
5461
5462 if (instance->PlasmaFW111) {
5463 iovPtr = (struct IOV_111 *)
5464 ((unsigned char *)ctrl_info + IOV_111_OFFSET);
5465 instance->requestorId = iovPtr->requestorId;
5466 }
5467 }
5468 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "SRIOV: VF requestorId %d\n",
5469 instance->requestorId);
5470 }
5471
5472 instance->crash_dump_fw_support =
5473 ctrl_info->adapterOperations3.supportCrashDump;
5474 instance->crash_dump_drv_support =
5475 (instance->crash_dump_fw_support &&
5476 instance->crash_dump_buf);
5477 if (instance->crash_dump_drv_support)
5478 megasas_set_crash_dump_params(instance,
5479 MR_CRASH_BUF_TURN_OFF);
5480
5481 else {
5482 if (instance->crash_dump_buf)
5483 pci_free_consistent(instance->pdev,
5484 CRASH_DMA_BUF_SIZE,
5485 instance->crash_dump_buf,
5486 instance->crash_dump_h);
5487 instance->crash_dump_buf = NULL;
5488 }
5489
5490
5491 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
5492 "pci id\t\t: (0x%04x)/(0x%04x)/(0x%04x)/(0x%04x)\n",
5493 le16_to_cpu(ctrl_info->pci.vendor_id),
5494 le16_to_cpu(ctrl_info->pci.device_id),
5495 le16_to_cpu(ctrl_info->pci.sub_vendor_id),
5496 le16_to_cpu(ctrl_info->pci.sub_device_id));
5497 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "unevenspan support : %s\n",
5498 instance->UnevenSpanSupport ? "yes" : "no");
5499 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "firmware crash dump : %s\n",
5500 instance->crash_dump_drv_support ? "yes" : "no");
5501 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "jbod sync map : %s\n",
5502 instance->use_seqnum_jbod_fp ? "yes" : "no");
5503
5504
5505 instance->max_sectors_per_req = instance->max_num_sge *
5506 SGE_BUFFER_SIZE / 512;
5507 if (tmp_sectors && (instance->max_sectors_per_req > tmp_sectors))
5508 instance->max_sectors_per_req = tmp_sectors;
5509
5510 /* Check for valid throttlequeuedepth module parameter */
5511 if (throttlequeuedepth &&
5512 throttlequeuedepth <= instance->max_scsi_cmds)
5513 instance->throttlequeuedepth = throttlequeuedepth;
5514 else
5515 instance->throttlequeuedepth =
5516 MEGASAS_THROTTLE_QUEUE_DEPTH;
5517
5518 if ((resetwaittime < 1) ||
5519 (resetwaittime > MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME))
5520 resetwaittime = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME;
5521
5522 if ((scmd_timeout < 10) || (scmd_timeout > MEGASAS_DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT))
5523 scmd_timeout = MEGASAS_DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT;
5524
5525 /* Launch SR-IOV heartbeat timer */
5526 if (instance->requestorId) {
5527 if (!megasas_sriov_start_heartbeat(instance, 1))
5528 megasas_start_timer(instance,
5529 &instance->sriov_heartbeat_timer,
5530 megasas_sriov_heartbeat_handler,
5531 MEGASAS_SRIOV_HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL_VF);
5532 else
5533 instance->skip_heartbeat_timer_del = 1;
5534 }
5535
5536 return 0;
5537
5538fail_get_ld_pd_list:
5539 instance->instancet->disable_intr(instance);
5540fail_init_adapter:
5541 megasas_destroy_irqs(instance);
5542fail_setup_irqs:
5543 if (instance->msix_vectors)
5544 pci_free_irq_vectors(instance->pdev);
5545 instance->msix_vectors = 0;
5546fail_ready_state:
5547 kfree(instance->ctrl_info);
5548 instance->ctrl_info = NULL;
5549 iounmap(instance->reg_set);
5550
5551fail_ioremap:
5552 pci_release_selected_regions(instance->pdev, 1<<instance->bar);
5553
5554 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Failed from %s %d\n",
5555 __func__, __LINE__);
5556 return -EINVAL;
5557}
5558
5559/**
5560 * megasas_release_mfi - Reverses the FW initialization
5561 * @instance: Adapter soft state
5562 */
5563static void megasas_release_mfi(struct megasas_instance *instance)
5564{
5565 u32 reply_q_sz = sizeof(u32) *(instance->max_mfi_cmds + 1);
5566
5567 if (instance->reply_queue)
5568 pci_free_consistent(instance->pdev, reply_q_sz,
5569 instance->reply_queue, instance->reply_queue_h);
5570
5571 megasas_free_cmds(instance);
5572
5573 iounmap(instance->reg_set);
5574
5575 pci_release_selected_regions(instance->pdev, 1<<instance->bar);
5576}
5577
5578/**
5579 * megasas_get_seq_num - Gets latest event sequence numbers
5580 * @instance: Adapter soft state
5581 * @eli: FW event log sequence numbers information
5582 *
5583 * FW maintains a log of all events in a non-volatile area. Upper layers would
5584 * usually find out the latest sequence number of the events, the seq number at
5585 * the boot etc. They would "read" all the events below the latest seq number
5586 * by issuing a direct fw cmd (DCMD). For the future events (beyond latest seq
5587 * number), they would subsribe to AEN (asynchronous event notification) and
5588 * wait for the events to happen.
5589 */
5590static int
5591megasas_get_seq_num(struct megasas_instance *instance,
5592 struct megasas_evt_log_info *eli)
5593{
5594 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
5595 struct megasas_dcmd_frame *dcmd;
5596 struct megasas_evt_log_info *el_info;
5597 dma_addr_t el_info_h = 0;
5598
5599 cmd = megasas_get_cmd(instance);
5600
5601 if (!cmd) {
5602 return -ENOMEM;
5603 }
5604
5605 dcmd = &cmd->frame->dcmd;
5606 el_info = pci_alloc_consistent(instance->pdev,
5607 sizeof(struct megasas_evt_log_info),
5608 &el_info_h);
5609
5610 if (!el_info) {
5611 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
5612 return -ENOMEM;
5613 }
5614
5615 memset(el_info, 0, sizeof(*el_info));
5616 memset(dcmd->mbox.b, 0, MFI_MBOX_SIZE);
5617
5618 dcmd->cmd = MFI_CMD_DCMD;
5619 dcmd->cmd_status = 0x0;
5620 dcmd->sge_count = 1;
5621 dcmd->flags = cpu_to_le16(MFI_FRAME_DIR_READ);
5622 dcmd->timeout = 0;
5623 dcmd->pad_0 = 0;
5624 dcmd->data_xfer_len = cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct megasas_evt_log_info));
5625 dcmd->opcode = cpu_to_le32(MR_DCMD_CTRL_EVENT_GET_INFO);
5626 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].phys_addr = cpu_to_le32(el_info_h);
5627 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].length = cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct megasas_evt_log_info));
5628
5629 if (megasas_issue_blocked_cmd(instance, cmd, MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_SECS) ==
5630 DCMD_SUCCESS) {
5631 /*
5632 * Copy the data back into callers buffer
5633 */
5634 eli->newest_seq_num = el_info->newest_seq_num;
5635 eli->oldest_seq_num = el_info->oldest_seq_num;
5636 eli->clear_seq_num = el_info->clear_seq_num;
5637 eli->shutdown_seq_num = el_info->shutdown_seq_num;
5638 eli->boot_seq_num = el_info->boot_seq_num;
5639 } else
5640 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "DCMD failed "
5641 "from %s\n", __func__);
5642
5643 pci_free_consistent(instance->pdev, sizeof(struct megasas_evt_log_info),
5644 el_info, el_info_h);
5645
5646 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
5647
5648 return 0;
5649}
5650
5651/**
5652 * megasas_register_aen - Registers for asynchronous event notification
5653 * @instance: Adapter soft state
5654 * @seq_num: The starting sequence number
5655 * @class_locale: Class of the event
5656 *
5657 * This function subscribes for AEN for events beyond the @seq_num. It requests
5658 * to be notified if and only if the event is of type @class_locale
5659 */
5660static int
5661megasas_register_aen(struct megasas_instance *instance, u32 seq_num,
5662 u32 class_locale_word)
5663{
5664 int ret_val;
5665 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
5666 struct megasas_dcmd_frame *dcmd;
5667 union megasas_evt_class_locale curr_aen;
5668 union megasas_evt_class_locale prev_aen;
5669
5670 /*
5671 * If there an AEN pending already (aen_cmd), check if the
5672 * class_locale of that pending AEN is inclusive of the new
5673 * AEN request we currently have. If it is, then we don't have
5674 * to do anything. In other words, whichever events the current
5675 * AEN request is subscribing to, have already been subscribed
5676 * to.
5677 *
5678 * If the old_cmd is _not_ inclusive, then we have to abort
5679 * that command, form a class_locale that is superset of both
5680 * old and current and re-issue to the FW
5681 */
5682
5683 curr_aen.word = class_locale_word;
5684
5685 if (instance->aen_cmd) {
5686
5687 prev_aen.word =
5688 le32_to_cpu(instance->aen_cmd->frame->dcmd.mbox.w[1]);
5689
5690 if ((curr_aen.members.class < MFI_EVT_CLASS_DEBUG) ||
5691 (curr_aen.members.class > MFI_EVT_CLASS_DEAD)) {
5692 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
5693 "%s %d out of range class %d send by application\n",
5694 __func__, __LINE__, curr_aen.members.class);
5695 return 0;
5696 }
5697
5698 /*
5699 * A class whose enum value is smaller is inclusive of all
5700 * higher values. If a PROGRESS (= -1) was previously
5701 * registered, then a new registration requests for higher
5702 * classes need not be sent to FW. They are automatically
5703 * included.
5704 *
5705 * Locale numbers don't have such hierarchy. They are bitmap
5706 * values
5707 */
5708 if ((prev_aen.members.class <= curr_aen.members.class) &&
5709 !((prev_aen.members.locale & curr_aen.members.locale) ^
5710 curr_aen.members.locale)) {
5711 /*
5712 * Previously issued event registration includes
5713 * current request. Nothing to do.
5714 */
5715 return 0;
5716 } else {
5717 curr_aen.members.locale |= prev_aen.members.locale;
5718
5719 if (prev_aen.members.class < curr_aen.members.class)
5720 curr_aen.members.class = prev_aen.members.class;
5721
5722 instance->aen_cmd->abort_aen = 1;
5723 ret_val = megasas_issue_blocked_abort_cmd(instance,
5724 instance->
5725 aen_cmd, 30);
5726
5727 if (ret_val) {
5728 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to abort "
5729 "previous AEN command\n");
5730 return ret_val;
5731 }
5732 }
5733 }
5734
5735 cmd = megasas_get_cmd(instance);
5736
5737 if (!cmd)
5738 return -ENOMEM;
5739
5740 dcmd = &cmd->frame->dcmd;
5741
5742 memset(instance->evt_detail, 0, sizeof(struct megasas_evt_detail));
5743
5744 /*
5745 * Prepare DCMD for aen registration
5746 */
5747 memset(dcmd->mbox.b, 0, MFI_MBOX_SIZE);
5748
5749 dcmd->cmd = MFI_CMD_DCMD;
5750 dcmd->cmd_status = 0x0;
5751 dcmd->sge_count = 1;
5752 dcmd->flags = cpu_to_le16(MFI_FRAME_DIR_READ);
5753 dcmd->timeout = 0;
5754 dcmd->pad_0 = 0;
5755 dcmd->data_xfer_len = cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct megasas_evt_detail));
5756 dcmd->opcode = cpu_to_le32(MR_DCMD_CTRL_EVENT_WAIT);
5757 dcmd->mbox.w[0] = cpu_to_le32(seq_num);
5758 instance->last_seq_num = seq_num;
5759 dcmd->mbox.w[1] = cpu_to_le32(curr_aen.word);
5760 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].phys_addr = cpu_to_le32(instance->evt_detail_h);
5761 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].length = cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct megasas_evt_detail));
5762
5763 if (instance->aen_cmd != NULL) {
5764 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
5765 return 0;
5766 }
5767
5768 /*
5769 * Store reference to the cmd used to register for AEN. When an
5770 * application wants us to register for AEN, we have to abort this
5771 * cmd and re-register with a new EVENT LOCALE supplied by that app
5772 */
5773 instance->aen_cmd = cmd;
5774
5775 /*
5776 * Issue the aen registration frame
5777 */
5778 instance->instancet->issue_dcmd(instance, cmd);
5779
5780 return 0;
5781}
5782
5783/* megasas_get_target_prop - Send DCMD with below details to firmware.
5784 *
5785 * This DCMD will fetch few properties of LD/system PD defined
5786 * in MR_TARGET_DEV_PROPERTIES. eg. Queue Depth, MDTS value.
5787 *
5788 * DCMD send by drivers whenever new target is added to the OS.
5789 *
5790 * dcmd.opcode - MR_DCMD_DEV_GET_TARGET_PROP
5791 * dcmd.mbox.b[0] - DCMD is to be fired for LD or system PD.
5792 * 0 = system PD, 1 = LD.
5793 * dcmd.mbox.s[1] - TargetID for LD/system PD.
5794 * dcmd.sge IN - Pointer to return MR_TARGET_DEV_PROPERTIES.
5795 *
5796 * @instance: Adapter soft state
5797 * @sdev: OS provided scsi device
5798 *
5799 * Returns 0 on success non-zero on failure.
5800 */
5801static int
5802megasas_get_target_prop(struct megasas_instance *instance,
5803 struct scsi_device *sdev)
5804{
5805 int ret;
5806 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
5807 struct megasas_dcmd_frame *dcmd;
5808 u16 targetId = (sdev->channel % 2) + sdev->id;
5809
5810 cmd = megasas_get_cmd(instance);
5811
5812 if (!cmd) {
5813 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
5814 "Failed to get cmd %s\n", __func__);
5815 return -ENOMEM;
5816 }
5817
5818 dcmd = &cmd->frame->dcmd;
5819
5820 memset(instance->tgt_prop, 0, sizeof(*instance->tgt_prop));
5821 memset(dcmd->mbox.b, 0, MFI_MBOX_SIZE);
5822 dcmd->mbox.b[0] = MEGASAS_IS_LOGICAL(sdev);
5823
5824 dcmd->mbox.s[1] = cpu_to_le16(targetId);
5825 dcmd->cmd = MFI_CMD_DCMD;
5826 dcmd->cmd_status = 0xFF;
5827 dcmd->sge_count = 1;
5828 dcmd->flags = cpu_to_le16(MFI_FRAME_DIR_READ);
5829 dcmd->timeout = 0;
5830 dcmd->pad_0 = 0;
5831 dcmd->data_xfer_len =
5832 cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct MR_TARGET_PROPERTIES));
5833 dcmd->opcode = cpu_to_le32(MR_DCMD_DRV_GET_TARGET_PROP);
5834 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].phys_addr =
5835 cpu_to_le32(instance->tgt_prop_h);
5836 dcmd->sgl.sge32[0].length =
5837 cpu_to_le32(sizeof(struct MR_TARGET_PROPERTIES));
5838
5839 if ((instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES) &&
5840 !instance->mask_interrupts)
5841 ret = megasas_issue_blocked_cmd(instance,
5842 cmd, MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_SECS);
5843 else
5844 ret = megasas_issue_polled(instance, cmd);
5845
5846 switch (ret) {
5847 case DCMD_TIMEOUT:
5848 switch (dcmd_timeout_ocr_possible(instance)) {
5849 case INITIATE_OCR:
5850 cmd->flags |= DRV_DCMD_SKIP_REFIRE;
5851 megasas_reset_fusion(instance->host,
5852 MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_OCR);
5853 break;
5854 case KILL_ADAPTER:
5855 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
5856 break;
5857 case IGNORE_TIMEOUT:
5858 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
5859 "Ignore DCMD timeout: %s %d\n",
5860 __func__, __LINE__);
5861 break;
5862 }
5863 break;
5864
5865 default:
5866 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
5867 }
5868 if (ret != DCMD_SUCCESS)
5869 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
5870 "return from %s %d return value %d\n",
5871 __func__, __LINE__, ret);
5872
5873 return ret;
5874}
5875
5876/**
5877 * megasas_start_aen - Subscribes to AEN during driver load time
5878 * @instance: Adapter soft state
5879 */
5880static int megasas_start_aen(struct megasas_instance *instance)
5881{
5882 struct megasas_evt_log_info eli;
5883 union megasas_evt_class_locale class_locale;
5884
5885 /*
5886 * Get the latest sequence number from FW
5887 */
5888 memset(&eli, 0, sizeof(eli));
5889
5890 if (megasas_get_seq_num(instance, &eli))
5891 return -1;
5892
5893 /*
5894 * Register AEN with FW for latest sequence number plus 1
5895 */
5896 class_locale.members.reserved = 0;
5897 class_locale.members.locale = MR_EVT_LOCALE_ALL;
5898 class_locale.members.class = MR_EVT_CLASS_DEBUG;
5899
5900 return megasas_register_aen(instance,
5901 le32_to_cpu(eli.newest_seq_num) + 1,
5902 class_locale.word);
5903}
5904
5905/**
5906 * megasas_io_attach - Attaches this driver to SCSI mid-layer
5907 * @instance: Adapter soft state
5908 */
5909static int megasas_io_attach(struct megasas_instance *instance)
5910{
5911 struct Scsi_Host *host = instance->host;
5912
5913 /*
5914 * Export parameters required by SCSI mid-layer
5915 */
5916 host->unique_id = instance->unique_id;
5917 host->can_queue = instance->max_scsi_cmds;
5918 host->this_id = instance->init_id;
5919 host->sg_tablesize = instance->max_num_sge;
5920
5921 if (instance->fw_support_ieee)
5922 instance->max_sectors_per_req = MEGASAS_MAX_SECTORS_IEEE;
5923
5924 /*
5925 * Check if the module parameter value for max_sectors can be used
5926 */
5927 if (max_sectors && max_sectors < instance->max_sectors_per_req)
5928 instance->max_sectors_per_req = max_sectors;
5929 else {
5930 if (max_sectors) {
5931 if (((instance->pdev->device ==
5932 PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS1078GEN2) ||
5933 (instance->pdev->device ==
5934 PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS0079GEN2)) &&
5935 (max_sectors <= MEGASAS_MAX_SECTORS)) {
5936 instance->max_sectors_per_req = max_sectors;
5937 } else {
5938 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "max_sectors should be > 0"
5939 "and <= %d (or < 1MB for GEN2 controller)\n",
5940 instance->max_sectors_per_req);
5941 }
5942 }
5943 }
5944
5945 host->max_sectors = instance->max_sectors_per_req;
5946 host->cmd_per_lun = MEGASAS_DEFAULT_CMD_PER_LUN;
5947 host->max_channel = MEGASAS_MAX_CHANNELS - 1;
5948 host->max_id = MEGASAS_MAX_DEV_PER_CHANNEL;
5949 host->max_lun = MEGASAS_MAX_LUN;
5950 host->max_cmd_len = 16;
5951
5952 /*
5953 * Notify the mid-layer about the new controller
5954 */
5955 if (scsi_add_host(host, &instance->pdev->dev)) {
5956 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
5957 "Failed to add host from %s %d\n",
5958 __func__, __LINE__);
5959 return -ENODEV;
5960 }
5961
5962 return 0;
5963}
5964
5965static int
5966megasas_set_dma_mask(struct pci_dev *pdev)
5967{
5968 /*
5969 * All our controllers are capable of performing 64-bit DMA
5970 */
5971 if (IS_DMA64) {
5972 if (pci_set_dma_mask(pdev, DMA_BIT_MASK(64)) != 0) {
5973
5974 if (pci_set_dma_mask(pdev, DMA_BIT_MASK(32)) != 0)
5975 goto fail_set_dma_mask;
5976 }
5977 } else {
5978 if (pci_set_dma_mask(pdev, DMA_BIT_MASK(32)) != 0)
5979 goto fail_set_dma_mask;
5980 }
5981 /*
5982 * Ensure that all data structures are allocated in 32-bit
5983 * memory.
5984 */
5985 if (pci_set_consistent_dma_mask(pdev, DMA_BIT_MASK(32)) != 0) {
5986 /* Try 32bit DMA mask and 32 bit Consistent dma mask */
5987 if (!pci_set_dma_mask(pdev, DMA_BIT_MASK(32))
5988 && !pci_set_consistent_dma_mask(pdev, DMA_BIT_MASK(32)))
5989 dev_info(&pdev->dev, "set 32bit DMA mask"
5990 "and 32 bit consistent mask\n");
5991 else
5992 goto fail_set_dma_mask;
5993 }
5994
5995 return 0;
5996
5997fail_set_dma_mask:
5998 return 1;
5999}
6000
6001/*
6002 * megasas_set_adapter_type - Set adapter type.
6003 * Supported controllers can be divided in
6004 * 4 categories- enum MR_ADAPTER_TYPE {
6005 * MFI_SERIES = 1,
6006 * THUNDERBOLT_SERIES = 2,
6007 * INVADER_SERIES = 3,
6008 * VENTURA_SERIES = 4,
6009 * };
6010 * @instance: Adapter soft state
6011 * return: void
6012 */
6013static inline void megasas_set_adapter_type(struct megasas_instance *instance)
6014{
6015 switch (instance->pdev->device) {
6016 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_VENTURA:
6017 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_HARPOON:
6018 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_TOMCAT:
6019 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_VENTURA_4PORT:
6020 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_CRUSADER_4PORT:
6021 instance->adapter_type = VENTURA_SERIES;
6022 break;
6023 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_FUSION:
6024 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_PLASMA:
6025 instance->adapter_type = THUNDERBOLT_SERIES;
6026 break;
6027 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_INVADER:
6028 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_INTRUDER:
6029 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_INTRUDER_24:
6030 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_CUTLASS_52:
6031 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_CUTLASS_53:
6032 case PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_FURY:
6033 instance->adapter_type = INVADER_SERIES;
6034 break;
6035 default: /* For all other supported controllers */
6036 instance->adapter_type = MFI_SERIES;
6037 break;
6038 }
6039}
6040
6041static inline int megasas_alloc_mfi_ctrl_mem(struct megasas_instance *instance)
6042{
6043 instance->producer = pci_alloc_consistent(instance->pdev, sizeof(u32),
6044 &instance->producer_h);
6045 instance->consumer = pci_alloc_consistent(instance->pdev, sizeof(u32),
6046 &instance->consumer_h);
6047
6048 if (!instance->producer || !instance->consumer) {
6049 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
6050 "Failed to allocate memory for producer, consumer\n");
6051 return -1;
6052 }
6053
6054 *instance->producer = 0;
6055 *instance->consumer = 0;
6056 return 0;
6057}
6058
6059/**
6060 * megasas_alloc_ctrl_mem - Allocate per controller memory for core data
6061 * structures which are not common across MFI
6062 * adapters and fusion adapters.
6063 * For MFI based adapters, allocate producer and
6064 * consumer buffers. For fusion adapters, allocate
6065 * memory for fusion context.
6066 * @instance: Adapter soft state
6067 * return: 0 for SUCCESS
6068 */
6069static int megasas_alloc_ctrl_mem(struct megasas_instance *instance)
6070{
6071 instance->reply_map = kzalloc(sizeof(unsigned int) * nr_cpu_ids,
6072 GFP_KERNEL);
6073 if (!instance->reply_map)
6074 return -ENOMEM;
6075
6076 switch (instance->adapter_type) {
6077 case MFI_SERIES:
6078 if (megasas_alloc_mfi_ctrl_mem(instance))
6079 goto fail;
6080 break;
6081 case VENTURA_SERIES:
6082 case THUNDERBOLT_SERIES:
6083 case INVADER_SERIES:
6084 if (megasas_alloc_fusion_context(instance))
6085 goto fail;
6086 break;
6087 }
6088
6089 return 0;
6090 fail:
6091 kfree(instance->reply_map);
6092 instance->reply_map = NULL;
6093 return -ENOMEM;
6094}
6095
6096/*
6097 * megasas_free_ctrl_mem - Free fusion context for fusion adapters and
6098 * producer, consumer buffers for MFI adapters
6099 *
6100 * @instance - Adapter soft instance
6101 *
6102 */
6103static inline void megasas_free_ctrl_mem(struct megasas_instance *instance)
6104{
6105 kfree(instance->reply_map);
6106 if (instance->adapter_type == MFI_SERIES) {
6107 if (instance->producer)
6108 pci_free_consistent(instance->pdev, sizeof(u32),
6109 instance->producer,
6110 instance->producer_h);
6111 if (instance->consumer)
6112 pci_free_consistent(instance->pdev, sizeof(u32),
6113 instance->consumer,
6114 instance->consumer_h);
6115 } else {
6116 megasas_free_fusion_context(instance);
6117 }
6118}
6119
6120/**
6121 * megasas_probe_one - PCI hotplug entry point
6122 * @pdev: PCI device structure
6123 * @id: PCI ids of supported hotplugged adapter
6124 */
6125static int megasas_probe_one(struct pci_dev *pdev,
6126 const struct pci_device_id *id)
6127{
6128 int rval, pos;
6129 struct Scsi_Host *host;
6130 struct megasas_instance *instance;
6131 u16 control = 0;
6132
6133 /* Reset MSI-X in the kdump kernel */
6134 if (reset_devices) {
6135 pos = pci_find_capability(pdev, PCI_CAP_ID_MSIX);
6136 if (pos) {
6137 pci_read_config_word(pdev, pos + PCI_MSIX_FLAGS,
6138 &control);
6139 if (control & PCI_MSIX_FLAGS_ENABLE) {
6140 dev_info(&pdev->dev, "resetting MSI-X\n");
6141 pci_write_config_word(pdev,
6142 pos + PCI_MSIX_FLAGS,
6143 control &
6144 ~PCI_MSIX_FLAGS_ENABLE);
6145 }
6146 }
6147 }
6148
6149 /*
6150 * PCI prepping: enable device set bus mastering and dma mask
6151 */
6152 rval = pci_enable_device_mem(pdev);
6153
6154 if (rval) {
6155 return rval;
6156 }
6157
6158 pci_set_master(pdev);
6159
6160 if (megasas_set_dma_mask(pdev))
6161 goto fail_set_dma_mask;
6162
6163 host = scsi_host_alloc(&megasas_template,
6164 sizeof(struct megasas_instance));
6165
6166 if (!host) {
6167 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &pdev->dev, "scsi_host_alloc failed\n");
6168 goto fail_alloc_instance;
6169 }
6170
6171 instance = (struct megasas_instance *)host->hostdata;
6172 memset(instance, 0, sizeof(*instance));
6173 atomic_set(&instance->fw_reset_no_pci_access, 0);
6174 instance->pdev = pdev;
6175
6176 megasas_set_adapter_type(instance);
6177
6178 if (megasas_alloc_ctrl_mem(instance))
6179 goto fail_alloc_dma_buf;
6180
6181 /* Crash dump feature related initialisation*/
6182 instance->drv_buf_index = 0;
6183 instance->drv_buf_alloc = 0;
6184 instance->crash_dump_fw_support = 0;
6185 instance->crash_dump_app_support = 0;
6186 instance->fw_crash_state = UNAVAILABLE;
6187 spin_lock_init(&instance->crashdump_lock);
6188 instance->crash_dump_buf = NULL;
6189
6190 megasas_poll_wait_aen = 0;
6191 instance->flag_ieee = 0;
6192 instance->ev = NULL;
6193 instance->issuepend_done = 1;
6194 atomic_set(&instance->adprecovery, MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL);
6195 instance->is_imr = 0;
6196
6197 instance->evt_detail = pci_alloc_consistent(pdev,
6198 sizeof(struct
6199 megasas_evt_detail),
6200 &instance->evt_detail_h);
6201
6202 if (!instance->evt_detail) {
6203 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &pdev->dev, "Failed to allocate memory for "
6204 "event detail structure\n");
6205 goto fail_alloc_dma_buf;
6206 }
6207
6208 if (!reset_devices) {
6209 instance->system_info_buf = pci_zalloc_consistent(pdev,
6210 sizeof(struct MR_DRV_SYSTEM_INFO),
6211 &instance->system_info_h);
6212 if (!instance->system_info_buf)
6213 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Can't allocate system info buffer\n");
6214
6215 instance->pd_info = pci_alloc_consistent(pdev,
6216 sizeof(struct MR_PD_INFO), &instance->pd_info_h);
6217
6218 if (!instance->pd_info)
6219 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to alloc mem for pd_info\n");
6220
6221 instance->tgt_prop = pci_alloc_consistent(pdev,
6222 sizeof(struct MR_TARGET_PROPERTIES), &instance->tgt_prop_h);
6223
6224 if (!instance->tgt_prop)
6225 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to alloc mem for tgt_prop\n");
6226
6227 instance->crash_dump_buf = pci_alloc_consistent(pdev,
6228 CRASH_DMA_BUF_SIZE,
6229 &instance->crash_dump_h);
6230 if (!instance->crash_dump_buf)
6231 dev_err(&pdev->dev, "Can't allocate Firmware "
6232 "crash dump DMA buffer\n");
6233 }
6234
6235 /*
6236 * Initialize locks and queues
6237 */
6238 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&instance->cmd_pool);
6239 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&instance->internal_reset_pending_q);
6240
6241 atomic_set(&instance->fw_outstanding,0);
6242
6243 init_waitqueue_head(&instance->int_cmd_wait_q);
6244 init_waitqueue_head(&instance->abort_cmd_wait_q);
6245
6246 spin_lock_init(&instance->mfi_pool_lock);
6247 spin_lock_init(&instance->hba_lock);
6248 spin_lock_init(&instance->stream_lock);
6249 spin_lock_init(&instance->completion_lock);
6250
6251 mutex_init(&instance->reset_mutex);
6252 mutex_init(&instance->hba_mutex);
6253
6254 /*
6255 * Initialize PCI related and misc parameters
6256 */
6257 instance->host = host;
6258 instance->unique_id = pdev->bus->number << 8 | pdev->devfn;
6259 instance->init_id = MEGASAS_DEFAULT_INIT_ID;
6260 instance->ctrl_info = NULL;
6261
6262
6263 if ((instance->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS0073SKINNY) ||
6264 (instance->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_LSI_SAS0071SKINNY))
6265 instance->flag_ieee = 1;
6266
6267 megasas_dbg_lvl = 0;
6268 instance->flag = 0;
6269 instance->unload = 1;
6270 instance->last_time = 0;
6271 instance->disableOnlineCtrlReset = 1;
6272 instance->UnevenSpanSupport = 0;
6273
6274 if (instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES) {
6275 INIT_WORK(&instance->work_init, megasas_fusion_ocr_wq);
6276 INIT_WORK(&instance->crash_init, megasas_fusion_crash_dump_wq);
6277 } else
6278 INIT_WORK(&instance->work_init, process_fw_state_change_wq);
6279
6280 /*
6281 * Initialize MFI Firmware
6282 */
6283 if (megasas_init_fw(instance))
6284 goto fail_init_mfi;
6285
6286 if (instance->requestorId) {
6287 if (instance->PlasmaFW111) {
6288 instance->vf_affiliation_111 =
6289 pci_alloc_consistent(pdev, sizeof(struct MR_LD_VF_AFFILIATION_111),
6290 &instance->vf_affiliation_111_h);
6291 if (!instance->vf_affiliation_111)
6292 dev_warn(&pdev->dev, "Can't allocate "
6293 "memory for VF affiliation buffer\n");
6294 } else {
6295 instance->vf_affiliation =
6296 pci_alloc_consistent(pdev,
6297 (MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES + 1) *
6298 sizeof(struct MR_LD_VF_AFFILIATION),
6299 &instance->vf_affiliation_h);
6300 if (!instance->vf_affiliation)
6301 dev_warn(&pdev->dev, "Can't allocate "
6302 "memory for VF affiliation buffer\n");
6303 }
6304 }
6305
6306 /*
6307 * Store instance in PCI softstate
6308 */
6309 pci_set_drvdata(pdev, instance);
6310
6311 /*
6312 * Add this controller to megasas_mgmt_info structure so that it
6313 * can be exported to management applications
6314 */
6315 megasas_mgmt_info.count++;
6316 megasas_mgmt_info.instance[megasas_mgmt_info.max_index] = instance;
6317 megasas_mgmt_info.max_index++;
6318
6319 /*
6320 * Register with SCSI mid-layer
6321 */
6322 if (megasas_io_attach(instance))
6323 goto fail_io_attach;
6324
6325 instance->unload = 0;
6326 /*
6327 * Trigger SCSI to scan our drives
6328 */
6329 scsi_scan_host(host);
6330
6331 /*
6332 * Initiate AEN (Asynchronous Event Notification)
6333 */
6334 if (megasas_start_aen(instance)) {
6335 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &pdev->dev, "start aen failed\n");
6336 goto fail_start_aen;
6337 }
6338
6339 /* Get current SR-IOV LD/VF affiliation */
6340 if (instance->requestorId)
6341 megasas_get_ld_vf_affiliation(instance, 1);
6342
6343 return 0;
6344
6345fail_start_aen:
6346fail_io_attach:
6347 megasas_mgmt_info.count--;
6348 megasas_mgmt_info.max_index--;
6349 megasas_mgmt_info.instance[megasas_mgmt_info.max_index] = NULL;
6350
6351 instance->instancet->disable_intr(instance);
6352 megasas_destroy_irqs(instance);
6353
6354 if (instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES)
6355 megasas_release_fusion(instance);
6356 else
6357 megasas_release_mfi(instance);
6358 if (instance->msix_vectors)
6359 pci_free_irq_vectors(instance->pdev);
6360fail_init_mfi:
6361fail_alloc_dma_buf:
6362 if (instance->evt_detail)
6363 pci_free_consistent(pdev, sizeof(struct megasas_evt_detail),
6364 instance->evt_detail,
6365 instance->evt_detail_h);
6366
6367 if (instance->pd_info)
6368 pci_free_consistent(pdev, sizeof(struct MR_PD_INFO),
6369 instance->pd_info,
6370 instance->pd_info_h);
6371 if (instance->tgt_prop)
6372 pci_free_consistent(pdev, sizeof(struct MR_TARGET_PROPERTIES),
6373 instance->tgt_prop,
6374 instance->tgt_prop_h);
6375 megasas_free_ctrl_mem(instance);
6376 scsi_host_put(host);
6377fail_alloc_instance:
6378fail_set_dma_mask:
6379 pci_disable_device(pdev);
6380
6381 return -ENODEV;
6382}
6383
6384/**
6385 * megasas_flush_cache - Requests FW to flush all its caches
6386 * @instance: Adapter soft state
6387 */
6388static void megasas_flush_cache(struct megasas_instance *instance)
6389{
6390 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
6391 struct megasas_dcmd_frame *dcmd;
6392
6393 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_HW_CRITICAL_ERROR)
6394 return;
6395
6396 cmd = megasas_get_cmd(instance);
6397
6398 if (!cmd)
6399 return;
6400
6401 dcmd = &cmd->frame->dcmd;
6402
6403 memset(dcmd->mbox.b, 0, MFI_MBOX_SIZE);
6404
6405 dcmd->cmd = MFI_CMD_DCMD;
6406 dcmd->cmd_status = 0x0;
6407 dcmd->sge_count = 0;
6408 dcmd->flags = cpu_to_le16(MFI_FRAME_DIR_NONE);
6409 dcmd->timeout = 0;
6410 dcmd->pad_0 = 0;
6411 dcmd->data_xfer_len = 0;
6412 dcmd->opcode = cpu_to_le32(MR_DCMD_CTRL_CACHE_FLUSH);
6413 dcmd->mbox.b[0] = MR_FLUSH_CTRL_CACHE | MR_FLUSH_DISK_CACHE;
6414
6415 if (megasas_issue_blocked_cmd(instance, cmd, MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_SECS)
6416 != DCMD_SUCCESS) {
6417 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
6418 "return from %s %d\n", __func__, __LINE__);
6419 return;
6420 }
6421
6422 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
6423}
6424
6425/**
6426 * megasas_shutdown_controller - Instructs FW to shutdown the controller
6427 * @instance: Adapter soft state
6428 * @opcode: Shutdown/Hibernate
6429 */
6430static void megasas_shutdown_controller(struct megasas_instance *instance,
6431 u32 opcode)
6432{
6433 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
6434 struct megasas_dcmd_frame *dcmd;
6435
6436 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_HW_CRITICAL_ERROR)
6437 return;
6438
6439 cmd = megasas_get_cmd(instance);
6440
6441 if (!cmd)
6442 return;
6443
6444 if (instance->aen_cmd)
6445 megasas_issue_blocked_abort_cmd(instance,
6446 instance->aen_cmd, MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_SECS);
6447 if (instance->map_update_cmd)
6448 megasas_issue_blocked_abort_cmd(instance,
6449 instance->map_update_cmd, MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_SECS);
6450 if (instance->jbod_seq_cmd)
6451 megasas_issue_blocked_abort_cmd(instance,
6452 instance->jbod_seq_cmd, MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_SECS);
6453
6454 dcmd = &cmd->frame->dcmd;
6455
6456 memset(dcmd->mbox.b, 0, MFI_MBOX_SIZE);
6457
6458 dcmd->cmd = MFI_CMD_DCMD;
6459 dcmd->cmd_status = 0x0;
6460 dcmd->sge_count = 0;
6461 dcmd->flags = cpu_to_le16(MFI_FRAME_DIR_NONE);
6462 dcmd->timeout = 0;
6463 dcmd->pad_0 = 0;
6464 dcmd->data_xfer_len = 0;
6465 dcmd->opcode = cpu_to_le32(opcode);
6466
6467 if (megasas_issue_blocked_cmd(instance, cmd, MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_SECS)
6468 != DCMD_SUCCESS) {
6469 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
6470 "return from %s %d\n", __func__, __LINE__);
6471 return;
6472 }
6473
6474 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
6475}
6476
6477#ifdef CONFIG_PM
6478/**
6479 * megasas_suspend - driver suspend entry point
6480 * @pdev: PCI device structure
6481 * @state: PCI power state to suspend routine
6482 */
6483static int
6484megasas_suspend(struct pci_dev *pdev, pm_message_t state)
6485{
6486 struct Scsi_Host *host;
6487 struct megasas_instance *instance;
6488
6489 instance = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
6490 host = instance->host;
6491 instance->unload = 1;
6492
6493 /* Shutdown SR-IOV heartbeat timer */
6494 if (instance->requestorId && !instance->skip_heartbeat_timer_del)
6495 del_timer_sync(&instance->sriov_heartbeat_timer);
6496
6497 megasas_flush_cache(instance);
6498 megasas_shutdown_controller(instance, MR_DCMD_HIBERNATE_SHUTDOWN);
6499
6500 /* cancel the delayed work if this work still in queue */
6501 if (instance->ev != NULL) {
6502 struct megasas_aen_event *ev = instance->ev;
6503 cancel_delayed_work_sync(&ev->hotplug_work);
6504 instance->ev = NULL;
6505 }
6506
6507 tasklet_kill(&instance->isr_tasklet);
6508
6509 pci_set_drvdata(instance->pdev, instance);
6510 instance->instancet->disable_intr(instance);
6511
6512 megasas_destroy_irqs(instance);
6513
6514 if (instance->msix_vectors)
6515 pci_free_irq_vectors(instance->pdev);
6516
6517 pci_save_state(pdev);
6518 pci_disable_device(pdev);
6519
6520 pci_set_power_state(pdev, pci_choose_state(pdev, state));
6521
6522 return 0;
6523}
6524
6525/**
6526 * megasas_resume- driver resume entry point
6527 * @pdev: PCI device structure
6528 */
6529static int
6530megasas_resume(struct pci_dev *pdev)
6531{
6532 int rval;
6533 struct Scsi_Host *host;
6534 struct megasas_instance *instance;
6535 int irq_flags = PCI_IRQ_LEGACY;
6536
6537 instance = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
6538 host = instance->host;
6539 pci_set_power_state(pdev, PCI_D0);
6540 pci_enable_wake(pdev, PCI_D0, 0);
6541 pci_restore_state(pdev);
6542
6543 /*
6544 * PCI prepping: enable device set bus mastering and dma mask
6545 */
6546 rval = pci_enable_device_mem(pdev);
6547
6548 if (rval) {
6549 dev_err(&pdev->dev, "Enable device failed\n");
6550 return rval;
6551 }
6552
6553 pci_set_master(pdev);
6554
6555 if (megasas_set_dma_mask(pdev))
6556 goto fail_set_dma_mask;
6557
6558 /*
6559 * Initialize MFI Firmware
6560 */
6561
6562 atomic_set(&instance->fw_outstanding, 0);
6563
6564 /*
6565 * We expect the FW state to be READY
6566 */
6567 if (megasas_transition_to_ready(instance, 0))
6568 goto fail_ready_state;
6569
6570 /* Now re-enable MSI-X */
6571 if (instance->msix_vectors) {
6572 irq_flags = PCI_IRQ_MSIX;
6573 if (smp_affinity_enable)
6574 irq_flags |= PCI_IRQ_AFFINITY;
6575 }
6576 rval = pci_alloc_irq_vectors(instance->pdev, 1,
6577 instance->msix_vectors ?
6578 instance->msix_vectors : 1, irq_flags);
6579 if (rval < 0)
6580 goto fail_reenable_msix;
6581
6582 megasas_setup_reply_map(instance);
6583
6584 if (instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES) {
6585 megasas_reset_reply_desc(instance);
6586 if (megasas_ioc_init_fusion(instance)) {
6587 megasas_free_cmds(instance);
6588 megasas_free_cmds_fusion(instance);
6589 goto fail_init_mfi;
6590 }
6591 if (!megasas_get_map_info(instance))
6592 megasas_sync_map_info(instance);
6593 } else {
6594 *instance->producer = 0;
6595 *instance->consumer = 0;
6596 if (megasas_issue_init_mfi(instance))
6597 goto fail_init_mfi;
6598 }
6599
6600 tasklet_init(&instance->isr_tasklet, instance->instancet->tasklet,
6601 (unsigned long)instance);
6602
6603 if (instance->msix_vectors ?
6604 megasas_setup_irqs_msix(instance, 0) :
6605 megasas_setup_irqs_ioapic(instance))
6606 goto fail_init_mfi;
6607
6608 /* Re-launch SR-IOV heartbeat timer */
6609 if (instance->requestorId) {
6610 if (!megasas_sriov_start_heartbeat(instance, 0))
6611 megasas_start_timer(instance,
6612 &instance->sriov_heartbeat_timer,
6613 megasas_sriov_heartbeat_handler,
6614 MEGASAS_SRIOV_HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL_VF);
6615 else {
6616 instance->skip_heartbeat_timer_del = 1;
6617 goto fail_init_mfi;
6618 }
6619 }
6620
6621 instance->instancet->enable_intr(instance);
6622 megasas_setup_jbod_map(instance);
6623 instance->unload = 0;
6624
6625 /*
6626 * Initiate AEN (Asynchronous Event Notification)
6627 */
6628 if (megasas_start_aen(instance))
6629 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Start AEN failed\n");
6630
6631 return 0;
6632
6633fail_init_mfi:
6634 if (instance->evt_detail)
6635 pci_free_consistent(pdev, sizeof(struct megasas_evt_detail),
6636 instance->evt_detail,
6637 instance->evt_detail_h);
6638
6639 if (instance->pd_info)
6640 pci_free_consistent(pdev, sizeof(struct MR_PD_INFO),
6641 instance->pd_info,
6642 instance->pd_info_h);
6643 if (instance->tgt_prop)
6644 pci_free_consistent(pdev, sizeof(struct MR_TARGET_PROPERTIES),
6645 instance->tgt_prop,
6646 instance->tgt_prop_h);
6647
6648 megasas_free_ctrl_mem(instance);
6649 scsi_host_put(host);
6650
6651fail_set_dma_mask:
6652fail_ready_state:
6653fail_reenable_msix:
6654
6655 pci_disable_device(pdev);
6656
6657 return -ENODEV;
6658}
6659#else
6660#define megasas_suspend NULL
6661#define megasas_resume NULL
6662#endif
6663
6664static inline int
6665megasas_wait_for_adapter_operational(struct megasas_instance *instance)
6666{
6667 int wait_time = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME * 2;
6668 int i;
6669
6670 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_HW_CRITICAL_ERROR)
6671 return 1;
6672
6673 for (i = 0; i < wait_time; i++) {
6674 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL)
6675 break;
6676
6677 if (!(i % MEGASAS_RESET_NOTICE_INTERVAL))
6678 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "waiting for controller reset to finish\n");
6679
6680 msleep(1000);
6681 }
6682
6683 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) != MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL) {
6684 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "%s timed out while waiting for HBA to recover.\n",
6685 __func__);
6686 return 1;
6687 }
6688
6689 return 0;
6690}
6691
6692/**
6693 * megasas_detach_one - PCI hot"un"plug entry point
6694 * @pdev: PCI device structure
6695 */
6696static void megasas_detach_one(struct pci_dev *pdev)
6697{
6698 int i;
6699 struct Scsi_Host *host;
6700 struct megasas_instance *instance;
6701 struct fusion_context *fusion;
6702 u32 pd_seq_map_sz;
6703
6704 instance = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
6705 host = instance->host;
6706 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
6707
6708 /* Shutdown SR-IOV heartbeat timer */
6709 if (instance->requestorId && !instance->skip_heartbeat_timer_del)
6710 del_timer_sync(&instance->sriov_heartbeat_timer);
6711
6712 if (instance->fw_crash_state != UNAVAILABLE)
6713 megasas_free_host_crash_buffer(instance);
6714 scsi_remove_host(instance->host);
6715 instance->unload = 1;
6716
6717 if (megasas_wait_for_adapter_operational(instance))
6718 goto skip_firing_dcmds;
6719
6720 megasas_flush_cache(instance);
6721 megasas_shutdown_controller(instance, MR_DCMD_CTRL_SHUTDOWN);
6722
6723skip_firing_dcmds:
6724 /* cancel the delayed work if this work still in queue*/
6725 if (instance->ev != NULL) {
6726 struct megasas_aen_event *ev = instance->ev;
6727 cancel_delayed_work_sync(&ev->hotplug_work);
6728 instance->ev = NULL;
6729 }
6730
6731 /* cancel all wait events */
6732 wake_up_all(&instance->int_cmd_wait_q);
6733
6734 tasklet_kill(&instance->isr_tasklet);
6735
6736 /*
6737 * Take the instance off the instance array. Note that we will not
6738 * decrement the max_index. We let this array be sparse array
6739 */
6740 for (i = 0; i < megasas_mgmt_info.max_index; i++) {
6741 if (megasas_mgmt_info.instance[i] == instance) {
6742 megasas_mgmt_info.count--;
6743 megasas_mgmt_info.instance[i] = NULL;
6744
6745 break;
6746 }
6747 }
6748
6749 instance->instancet->disable_intr(instance);
6750
6751 megasas_destroy_irqs(instance);
6752
6753 if (instance->msix_vectors)
6754 pci_free_irq_vectors(instance->pdev);
6755
6756 if (instance->adapter_type == VENTURA_SERIES) {
6757 for (i = 0; i < MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES_EXT; ++i)
6758 kfree(fusion->stream_detect_by_ld[i]);
6759 kfree(fusion->stream_detect_by_ld);
6760 fusion->stream_detect_by_ld = NULL;
6761 }
6762
6763
6764 if (instance->adapter_type != MFI_SERIES) {
6765 megasas_release_fusion(instance);
6766 pd_seq_map_sz = sizeof(struct MR_PD_CFG_SEQ_NUM_SYNC) +
6767 (sizeof(struct MR_PD_CFG_SEQ) *
6768 (MAX_PHYSICAL_DEVICES - 1));
6769 for (i = 0; i < 2 ; i++) {
6770 if (fusion->ld_map[i])
6771 dma_free_coherent(&instance->pdev->dev,
6772 fusion->max_map_sz,
6773 fusion->ld_map[i],
6774 fusion->ld_map_phys[i]);
6775 if (fusion->ld_drv_map[i]) {
6776 if (is_vmalloc_addr(fusion->ld_drv_map[i]))
6777 vfree(fusion->ld_drv_map[i]);
6778 else
6779 free_pages((ulong)fusion->ld_drv_map[i],
6780 fusion->drv_map_pages);
6781 }
6782
6783 if (fusion->pd_seq_sync[i])
6784 dma_free_coherent(&instance->pdev->dev,
6785 pd_seq_map_sz,
6786 fusion->pd_seq_sync[i],
6787 fusion->pd_seq_phys[i]);
6788 }
6789 } else {
6790 megasas_release_mfi(instance);
6791 }
6792
6793 kfree(instance->ctrl_info);
6794
6795 if (instance->evt_detail)
6796 pci_free_consistent(pdev, sizeof(struct megasas_evt_detail),
6797 instance->evt_detail, instance->evt_detail_h);
6798 if (instance->pd_info)
6799 pci_free_consistent(pdev, sizeof(struct MR_PD_INFO),
6800 instance->pd_info,
6801 instance->pd_info_h);
6802 if (instance->tgt_prop)
6803 pci_free_consistent(pdev, sizeof(struct MR_TARGET_PROPERTIES),
6804 instance->tgt_prop,
6805 instance->tgt_prop_h);
6806 if (instance->vf_affiliation)
6807 pci_free_consistent(pdev, (MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES + 1) *
6808 sizeof(struct MR_LD_VF_AFFILIATION),
6809 instance->vf_affiliation,
6810 instance->vf_affiliation_h);
6811
6812 if (instance->vf_affiliation_111)
6813 pci_free_consistent(pdev,
6814 sizeof(struct MR_LD_VF_AFFILIATION_111),
6815 instance->vf_affiliation_111,
6816 instance->vf_affiliation_111_h);
6817
6818 if (instance->hb_host_mem)
6819 pci_free_consistent(pdev, sizeof(struct MR_CTRL_HB_HOST_MEM),
6820 instance->hb_host_mem,
6821 instance->hb_host_mem_h);
6822
6823 if (instance->crash_dump_buf)
6824 pci_free_consistent(pdev, CRASH_DMA_BUF_SIZE,
6825 instance->crash_dump_buf, instance->crash_dump_h);
6826
6827 if (instance->system_info_buf)
6828 pci_free_consistent(pdev, sizeof(struct MR_DRV_SYSTEM_INFO),
6829 instance->system_info_buf, instance->system_info_h);
6830
6831 megasas_free_ctrl_mem(instance);
6832
6833 scsi_host_put(host);
6834
6835 pci_disable_device(pdev);
6836}
6837
6838/**
6839 * megasas_shutdown - Shutdown entry point
6840 * @device: Generic device structure
6841 */
6842static void megasas_shutdown(struct pci_dev *pdev)
6843{
6844 struct megasas_instance *instance = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
6845
6846 instance->unload = 1;
6847
6848 if (megasas_wait_for_adapter_operational(instance))
6849 goto skip_firing_dcmds;
6850
6851 megasas_flush_cache(instance);
6852 megasas_shutdown_controller(instance, MR_DCMD_CTRL_SHUTDOWN);
6853
6854skip_firing_dcmds:
6855 instance->instancet->disable_intr(instance);
6856 megasas_destroy_irqs(instance);
6857
6858 if (instance->msix_vectors)
6859 pci_free_irq_vectors(instance->pdev);
6860}
6861
6862/**
6863 * megasas_mgmt_open - char node "open" entry point
6864 */
6865static int megasas_mgmt_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *filep)
6866{
6867 /*
6868 * Allow only those users with admin rights
6869 */
6870 if (!capable(CAP_SYS_ADMIN))
6871 return -EACCES;
6872
6873 return 0;
6874}
6875
6876/**
6877 * megasas_mgmt_fasync - Async notifier registration from applications
6878 *
6879 * This function adds the calling process to a driver global queue. When an
6880 * event occurs, SIGIO will be sent to all processes in this queue.
6881 */
6882static int megasas_mgmt_fasync(int fd, struct file *filep, int mode)
6883{
6884 int rc;
6885
6886 mutex_lock(&megasas_async_queue_mutex);
6887
6888 rc = fasync_helper(fd, filep, mode, &megasas_async_queue);
6889
6890 mutex_unlock(&megasas_async_queue_mutex);
6891
6892 if (rc >= 0) {
6893 /* For sanity check when we get ioctl */
6894 filep->private_data = filep;
6895 return 0;
6896 }
6897
6898 printk(KERN_DEBUG "megasas: fasync_helper failed [%d]\n", rc);
6899
6900 return rc;
6901}
6902
6903/**
6904 * megasas_mgmt_poll - char node "poll" entry point
6905 * */
6906static unsigned int megasas_mgmt_poll(struct file *file, poll_table *wait)
6907{
6908 unsigned int mask;
6909 unsigned long flags;
6910
6911 poll_wait(file, &megasas_poll_wait, wait);
6912 spin_lock_irqsave(&poll_aen_lock, flags);
6913 if (megasas_poll_wait_aen)
6914 mask = (POLLIN | POLLRDNORM);
6915 else
6916 mask = 0;
6917 megasas_poll_wait_aen = 0;
6918 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&poll_aen_lock, flags);
6919 return mask;
6920}
6921
6922/*
6923 * megasas_set_crash_dump_params_ioctl:
6924 * Send CRASH_DUMP_MODE DCMD to all controllers
6925 * @cmd: MFI command frame
6926 */
6927
6928static int megasas_set_crash_dump_params_ioctl(struct megasas_cmd *cmd)
6929{
6930 struct megasas_instance *local_instance;
6931 int i, error = 0;
6932 int crash_support;
6933
6934 crash_support = cmd->frame->dcmd.mbox.w[0];
6935
6936 for (i = 0; i < megasas_mgmt_info.max_index; i++) {
6937 local_instance = megasas_mgmt_info.instance[i];
6938 if (local_instance && local_instance->crash_dump_drv_support) {
6939 if ((atomic_read(&local_instance->adprecovery) ==
6940 MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL) &&
6941 !megasas_set_crash_dump_params(local_instance,
6942 crash_support)) {
6943 local_instance->crash_dump_app_support =
6944 crash_support;
6945 dev_info(&local_instance->pdev->dev,
6946 "Application firmware crash "
6947 "dump mode set success\n");
6948 error = 0;
6949 } else {
6950 dev_info(&local_instance->pdev->dev,
6951 "Application firmware crash "
6952 "dump mode set failed\n");
6953 error = -1;
6954 }
6955 }
6956 }
6957 return error;
6958}
6959
6960/**
6961 * megasas_mgmt_fw_ioctl - Issues management ioctls to FW
6962 * @instance: Adapter soft state
6963 * @argp: User's ioctl packet
6964 */
6965static int
6966megasas_mgmt_fw_ioctl(struct megasas_instance *instance,
6967 struct megasas_iocpacket __user * user_ioc,
6968 struct megasas_iocpacket *ioc)
6969{
6970 struct megasas_sge32 *kern_sge32;
6971 struct megasas_cmd *cmd;
6972 void *kbuff_arr[MAX_IOCTL_SGE];
6973 dma_addr_t buf_handle = 0;
6974 int error = 0, i;
6975 void *sense = NULL;
6976 dma_addr_t sense_handle;
6977 unsigned long *sense_ptr;
6978 u32 opcode;
6979
6980 memset(kbuff_arr, 0, sizeof(kbuff_arr));
6981
6982 if (ioc->sge_count > MAX_IOCTL_SGE) {
6983 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "SGE count [%d] > max limit [%d]\n",
6984 ioc->sge_count, MAX_IOCTL_SGE);
6985 return -EINVAL;
6986 }
6987
6988 cmd = megasas_get_cmd(instance);
6989 if (!cmd) {
6990 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to get a cmd packet\n");
6991 return -ENOMEM;
6992 }
6993
6994 /*
6995 * User's IOCTL packet has 2 frames (maximum). Copy those two
6996 * frames into our cmd's frames. cmd->frame's context will get
6997 * overwritten when we copy from user's frames. So set that value
6998 * alone separately
6999 */
7000 memcpy(cmd->frame, ioc->frame.raw, 2 * MEGAMFI_FRAME_SIZE);
7001 cmd->frame->hdr.context = cpu_to_le32(cmd->index);
7002 cmd->frame->hdr.pad_0 = 0;
7003 cmd->frame->hdr.flags &= cpu_to_le16(~(MFI_FRAME_IEEE |
7004 MFI_FRAME_SGL64 |
7005 MFI_FRAME_SENSE64));
7006 opcode = le32_to_cpu(cmd->frame->dcmd.opcode);
7007
7008 if (opcode == MR_DCMD_CTRL_SHUTDOWN) {
7009 if (megasas_get_ctrl_info(instance) != DCMD_SUCCESS) {
7010 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
7011 return -1;
7012 }
7013 }
7014
7015 if (opcode == MR_DRIVER_SET_APP_CRASHDUMP_MODE) {
7016 error = megasas_set_crash_dump_params_ioctl(cmd);
7017 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
7018 return error;
7019 }
7020
7021 /*
7022 * The management interface between applications and the fw uses
7023 * MFI frames. E.g, RAID configuration changes, LD property changes
7024 * etc are accomplishes through different kinds of MFI frames. The
7025 * driver needs to care only about substituting user buffers with
7026 * kernel buffers in SGLs. The location of SGL is embedded in the
7027 * struct iocpacket itself.
7028 */
7029 kern_sge32 = (struct megasas_sge32 *)
7030 ((unsigned long)cmd->frame + ioc->sgl_off);
7031
7032 /*
7033 * For each user buffer, create a mirror buffer and copy in
7034 */
7035 for (i = 0; i < ioc->sge_count; i++) {
7036 if (!ioc->sgl[i].iov_len)
7037 continue;
7038
7039 kbuff_arr[i] = dma_alloc_coherent(&instance->pdev->dev,
7040 ioc->sgl[i].iov_len,
7041 &buf_handle, GFP_KERNEL);
7042 if (!kbuff_arr[i]) {
7043 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to alloc "
7044 "kernel SGL buffer for IOCTL\n");
7045 error = -ENOMEM;
7046 goto out;
7047 }
7048
7049 /*
7050 * We don't change the dma_coherent_mask, so
7051 * pci_alloc_consistent only returns 32bit addresses
7052 */
7053 kern_sge32[i].phys_addr = cpu_to_le32(buf_handle);
7054 kern_sge32[i].length = cpu_to_le32(ioc->sgl[i].iov_len);
7055
7056 /*
7057 * We created a kernel buffer corresponding to the
7058 * user buffer. Now copy in from the user buffer
7059 */
7060 if (copy_from_user(kbuff_arr[i], ioc->sgl[i].iov_base,
7061 (u32) (ioc->sgl[i].iov_len))) {
7062 error = -EFAULT;
7063 goto out;
7064 }
7065 }
7066
7067 if (ioc->sense_len) {
7068 sense = dma_alloc_coherent(&instance->pdev->dev, ioc->sense_len,
7069 &sense_handle, GFP_KERNEL);
7070 if (!sense) {
7071 error = -ENOMEM;
7072 goto out;
7073 }
7074
7075 sense_ptr =
7076 (unsigned long *) ((unsigned long)cmd->frame + ioc->sense_off);
7077 *sense_ptr = cpu_to_le32(sense_handle);
7078 }
7079
7080 /*
7081 * Set the sync_cmd flag so that the ISR knows not to complete this
7082 * cmd to the SCSI mid-layer
7083 */
7084 cmd->sync_cmd = 1;
7085 if (megasas_issue_blocked_cmd(instance, cmd, 0) == DCMD_NOT_FIRED) {
7086 cmd->sync_cmd = 0;
7087 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
7088 "return -EBUSY from %s %d opcode 0x%x cmd->cmd_status_drv 0x%x\n",
7089 __func__, __LINE__, opcode, cmd->cmd_status_drv);
7090 return -EBUSY;
7091 }
7092
7093 cmd->sync_cmd = 0;
7094
7095 if (instance->unload == 1) {
7096 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Driver unload is in progress "
7097 "don't submit data to application\n");
7098 goto out;
7099 }
7100 /*
7101 * copy out the kernel buffers to user buffers
7102 */
7103 for (i = 0; i < ioc->sge_count; i++) {
7104 if (copy_to_user(ioc->sgl[i].iov_base, kbuff_arr[i],
7105 ioc->sgl[i].iov_len)) {
7106 error = -EFAULT;
7107 goto out;
7108 }
7109 }
7110
7111 /*
7112 * copy out the sense
7113 */
7114 if (ioc->sense_len) {
7115 /*
7116 * sense_ptr points to the location that has the user
7117 * sense buffer address
7118 */
7119 sense_ptr = (unsigned long *) ((unsigned long)ioc->frame.raw +
7120 ioc->sense_off);
7121
7122 if (copy_to_user((void __user *)((unsigned long)
7123 get_unaligned((unsigned long *)sense_ptr)),
7124 sense, ioc->sense_len)) {
7125 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to copy out to user "
7126 "sense data\n");
7127 error = -EFAULT;
7128 goto out;
7129 }
7130 }
7131
7132 /*
7133 * copy the status codes returned by the fw
7134 */
7135 if (copy_to_user(&user_ioc->frame.hdr.cmd_status,
7136 &cmd->frame->hdr.cmd_status, sizeof(u8))) {
7137 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &instance->pdev->dev, "Error copying out cmd_status\n");
7138 error = -EFAULT;
7139 }
7140
7141out:
7142 if (sense) {
7143 dma_free_coherent(&instance->pdev->dev, ioc->sense_len,
7144 sense, sense_handle);
7145 }
7146
7147 for (i = 0; i < ioc->sge_count; i++) {
7148 if (kbuff_arr[i]) {
7149 dma_free_coherent(&instance->pdev->dev,
7150 le32_to_cpu(kern_sge32[i].length),
7151 kbuff_arr[i],
7152 le32_to_cpu(kern_sge32[i].phys_addr));
7153 kbuff_arr[i] = NULL;
7154 }
7155 }
7156
7157 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd);
7158 return error;
7159}
7160
7161static int megasas_mgmt_ioctl_fw(struct file *file, unsigned long arg)
7162{
7163 struct megasas_iocpacket __user *user_ioc =
7164 (struct megasas_iocpacket __user *)arg;
7165 struct megasas_iocpacket *ioc;
7166 struct megasas_instance *instance;
7167 int error;
7168 int i;
7169 unsigned long flags;
7170 u32 wait_time = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME;
7171
7172 ioc = memdup_user(user_ioc, sizeof(*ioc));
7173 if (IS_ERR(ioc))
7174 return PTR_ERR(ioc);
7175
7176 instance = megasas_lookup_instance(ioc->host_no);
7177 if (!instance) {
7178 error = -ENODEV;
7179 goto out_kfree_ioc;
7180 }
7181
7182 /* Adjust ioctl wait time for VF mode */
7183 if (instance->requestorId)
7184 wait_time = MEGASAS_ROUTINE_WAIT_TIME_VF;
7185
7186 /* Block ioctls in VF mode */
7187 if (instance->requestorId && !allow_vf_ioctls) {
7188 error = -ENODEV;
7189 goto out_kfree_ioc;
7190 }
7191
7192 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_HW_CRITICAL_ERROR) {
7193 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Controller in crit error\n");
7194 error = -ENODEV;
7195 goto out_kfree_ioc;
7196 }
7197
7198 if (instance->unload == 1) {
7199 error = -ENODEV;
7200 goto out_kfree_ioc;
7201 }
7202
7203 if (down_interruptible(&instance->ioctl_sem)) {
7204 error = -ERESTARTSYS;
7205 goto out_kfree_ioc;
7206 }
7207
7208 for (i = 0; i < wait_time; i++) {
7209
7210 spin_lock_irqsave(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
7211 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL) {
7212 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
7213 break;
7214 }
7215 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
7216
7217 if (!(i % MEGASAS_RESET_NOTICE_INTERVAL)) {
7218 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "waiting"
7219 "for controller reset to finish\n");
7220 }
7221
7222 msleep(1000);
7223 }
7224
7225 spin_lock_irqsave(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
7226 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) != MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL) {
7227 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
7228
7229 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "timed out while waiting for HBA to recover\n");
7230 error = -ENODEV;
7231 goto out_up;
7232 }
7233 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
7234
7235 error = megasas_mgmt_fw_ioctl(instance, user_ioc, ioc);
7236out_up:
7237 up(&instance->ioctl_sem);
7238
7239out_kfree_ioc:
7240 kfree(ioc);
7241 return error;
7242}
7243
7244static int megasas_mgmt_ioctl_aen(struct file *file, unsigned long arg)
7245{
7246 struct megasas_instance *instance;
7247 struct megasas_aen aen;
7248 int error;
7249 int i;
7250 unsigned long flags;
7251 u32 wait_time = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME;
7252
7253 if (file->private_data != file) {
7254 printk(KERN_DEBUG "megasas: fasync_helper was not "
7255 "called first\n");
7256 return -EINVAL;
7257 }
7258
7259 if (copy_from_user(&aen, (void __user *)arg, sizeof(aen)))
7260 return -EFAULT;
7261
7262 instance = megasas_lookup_instance(aen.host_no);
7263
7264 if (!instance)
7265 return -ENODEV;
7266
7267 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_HW_CRITICAL_ERROR) {
7268 return -ENODEV;
7269 }
7270
7271 if (instance->unload == 1) {
7272 return -ENODEV;
7273 }
7274
7275 for (i = 0; i < wait_time; i++) {
7276
7277 spin_lock_irqsave(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
7278 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL) {
7279 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->hba_lock,
7280 flags);
7281 break;
7282 }
7283
7284 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
7285
7286 if (!(i % MEGASAS_RESET_NOTICE_INTERVAL)) {
7287 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "waiting for"
7288 "controller reset to finish\n");
7289 }
7290
7291 msleep(1000);
7292 }
7293
7294 spin_lock_irqsave(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
7295 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) != MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL) {
7296 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
7297 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "timed out while waiting for HBA to recover\n");
7298 return -ENODEV;
7299 }
7300 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
7301
7302 mutex_lock(&instance->reset_mutex);
7303 error = megasas_register_aen(instance, aen.seq_num,
7304 aen.class_locale_word);
7305 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
7306 return error;
7307}
7308
7309/**
7310 * megasas_mgmt_ioctl - char node ioctl entry point
7311 */
7312static long
7313megasas_mgmt_ioctl(struct file *file, unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
7314{
7315 switch (cmd) {
7316 case MEGASAS_IOC_FIRMWARE:
7317 return megasas_mgmt_ioctl_fw(file, arg);
7318
7319 case MEGASAS_IOC_GET_AEN:
7320 return megasas_mgmt_ioctl_aen(file, arg);
7321 }
7322
7323 return -ENOTTY;
7324}
7325
7326#ifdef CONFIG_COMPAT
7327static int megasas_mgmt_compat_ioctl_fw(struct file *file, unsigned long arg)
7328{
7329 struct compat_megasas_iocpacket __user *cioc =
7330 (struct compat_megasas_iocpacket __user *)arg;
7331 struct megasas_iocpacket __user *ioc =
7332 compat_alloc_user_space(sizeof(struct megasas_iocpacket));
7333 int i;
7334 int error = 0;
7335 compat_uptr_t ptr;
7336 u32 local_sense_off;
7337 u32 local_sense_len;
7338 u32 user_sense_off;
7339
7340 if (clear_user(ioc, sizeof(*ioc)))
7341 return -EFAULT;
7342
7343 if (copy_in_user(&ioc->host_no, &cioc->host_no, sizeof(u16)) ||
7344 copy_in_user(&ioc->sgl_off, &cioc->sgl_off, sizeof(u32)) ||
7345 copy_in_user(&ioc->sense_off, &cioc->sense_off, sizeof(u32)) ||
7346 copy_in_user(&ioc->sense_len, &cioc->sense_len, sizeof(u32)) ||
7347 copy_in_user(ioc->frame.raw, cioc->frame.raw, 128) ||
7348 copy_in_user(&ioc->sge_count, &cioc->sge_count, sizeof(u32)))
7349 return -EFAULT;
7350
7351 /*
7352 * The sense_ptr is used in megasas_mgmt_fw_ioctl only when
7353 * sense_len is not null, so prepare the 64bit value under
7354 * the same condition.
7355 */
7356 if (get_user(local_sense_off, &ioc->sense_off) ||
7357 get_user(local_sense_len, &ioc->sense_len) ||
7358 get_user(user_sense_off, &cioc->sense_off))
7359 return -EFAULT;
7360
7361 if (local_sense_len) {
7362 void __user **sense_ioc_ptr =
7363 (void __user **)((u8 *)((unsigned long)&ioc->frame.raw) + local_sense_off);
7364 compat_uptr_t *sense_cioc_ptr =
7365 (compat_uptr_t *)(((unsigned long)&cioc->frame.raw) + user_sense_off);
7366 if (get_user(ptr, sense_cioc_ptr) ||
7367 put_user(compat_ptr(ptr), sense_ioc_ptr))
7368 return -EFAULT;
7369 }
7370
7371 for (i = 0; i < MAX_IOCTL_SGE; i++) {
7372 if (get_user(ptr, &cioc->sgl[i].iov_base) ||
7373 put_user(compat_ptr(ptr), &ioc->sgl[i].iov_base) ||
7374 copy_in_user(&ioc->sgl[i].iov_len,
7375 &cioc->sgl[i].iov_len, sizeof(compat_size_t)))
7376 return -EFAULT;
7377 }
7378
7379 error = megasas_mgmt_ioctl_fw(file, (unsigned long)ioc);
7380
7381 if (copy_in_user(&cioc->frame.hdr.cmd_status,
7382 &ioc->frame.hdr.cmd_status, sizeof(u8))) {
7383 printk(KERN_DEBUG "megasas: error copy_in_user cmd_status\n");
7384 return -EFAULT;
7385 }
7386 return error;
7387}
7388
7389static long
7390megasas_mgmt_compat_ioctl(struct file *file, unsigned int cmd,
7391 unsigned long arg)
7392{
7393 switch (cmd) {
7394 case MEGASAS_IOC_FIRMWARE32:
7395 return megasas_mgmt_compat_ioctl_fw(file, arg);
7396 case MEGASAS_IOC_GET_AEN:
7397 return megasas_mgmt_ioctl_aen(file, arg);
7398 }
7399
7400 return -ENOTTY;
7401}
7402#endif
7403
7404/*
7405 * File operations structure for management interface
7406 */
7407static const struct file_operations megasas_mgmt_fops = {
7408 .owner = THIS_MODULE,
7409 .open = megasas_mgmt_open,
7410 .fasync = megasas_mgmt_fasync,
7411 .unlocked_ioctl = megasas_mgmt_ioctl,
7412 .poll = megasas_mgmt_poll,
7413#ifdef CONFIG_COMPAT
7414 .compat_ioctl = megasas_mgmt_compat_ioctl,
7415#endif
7416 .llseek = noop_llseek,
7417};
7418
7419/*
7420 * PCI hotplug support registration structure
7421 */
7422static struct pci_driver megasas_pci_driver = {
7423
7424 .name = "megaraid_sas",
7425 .id_table = megasas_pci_table,
7426 .probe = megasas_probe_one,
7427 .remove = megasas_detach_one,
7428 .suspend = megasas_suspend,
7429 .resume = megasas_resume,
7430 .shutdown = megasas_shutdown,
7431};
7432
7433/*
7434 * Sysfs driver attributes
7435 */
7436static ssize_t version_show(struct device_driver *dd, char *buf)
7437{
7438 return snprintf(buf, strlen(MEGASAS_VERSION) + 2, "%s\n",
7439 MEGASAS_VERSION);
7440}
7441static DRIVER_ATTR_RO(version);
7442
7443static ssize_t release_date_show(struct device_driver *dd, char *buf)
7444{
7445 return snprintf(buf, strlen(MEGASAS_RELDATE) + 2, "%s\n",
7446 MEGASAS_RELDATE);
7447}
7448static DRIVER_ATTR_RO(release_date);
7449
7450static ssize_t support_poll_for_event_show(struct device_driver *dd, char *buf)
7451{
7452 return sprintf(buf, "%u\n", support_poll_for_event);
7453}
7454static DRIVER_ATTR_RO(support_poll_for_event);
7455
7456static ssize_t support_device_change_show(struct device_driver *dd, char *buf)
7457{
7458 return sprintf(buf, "%u\n", support_device_change);
7459}
7460static DRIVER_ATTR_RO(support_device_change);
7461
7462static ssize_t dbg_lvl_show(struct device_driver *dd, char *buf)
7463{
7464 return sprintf(buf, "%u\n", megasas_dbg_lvl);
7465}
7466
7467static ssize_t dbg_lvl_store(struct device_driver *dd, const char *buf,
7468 size_t count)
7469{
7470 int retval = count;
7471
7472 if (sscanf(buf, "%u", &megasas_dbg_lvl) < 1) {
7473 printk(KERN_ERR "megasas: could not set dbg_lvl\n");
7474 retval = -EINVAL;
7475 }
7476 return retval;
7477}
7478static DRIVER_ATTR_RW(dbg_lvl);
7479
7480static inline void megasas_remove_scsi_device(struct scsi_device *sdev)
7481{
7482 sdev_printk(KERN_INFO, sdev, "SCSI device is removed\n");
7483 scsi_remove_device(sdev);
7484 scsi_device_put(sdev);
7485}
7486
7487static void
7488megasas_aen_polling(struct work_struct *work)
7489{
7490 struct megasas_aen_event *ev =
7491 container_of(work, struct megasas_aen_event, hotplug_work.work);
7492 struct megasas_instance *instance = ev->instance;
7493 union megasas_evt_class_locale class_locale;
7494 struct Scsi_Host *host;
7495 struct scsi_device *sdev1;
7496 u16 pd_index = 0;
7497 u16 ld_index = 0;
7498 int i, j, doscan = 0;
7499 u32 seq_num, wait_time = MEGASAS_RESET_WAIT_TIME;
7500 int error;
7501 u8 dcmd_ret = DCMD_SUCCESS;
7502
7503 if (!instance) {
7504 printk(KERN_ERR "invalid instance!\n");
7505 kfree(ev);
7506 return;
7507 }
7508
7509 /* Adjust event workqueue thread wait time for VF mode */
7510 if (instance->requestorId)
7511 wait_time = MEGASAS_ROUTINE_WAIT_TIME_VF;
7512
7513 /* Don't run the event workqueue thread if OCR is running */
7514 mutex_lock(&instance->reset_mutex);
7515
7516 instance->ev = NULL;
7517 host = instance->host;
7518 if (instance->evt_detail) {
7519 megasas_decode_evt(instance);
7520
7521 switch (le32_to_cpu(instance->evt_detail->code)) {
7522
7523 case MR_EVT_PD_INSERTED:
7524 case MR_EVT_PD_REMOVED:
7525 dcmd_ret = megasas_get_pd_list(instance);
7526 if (dcmd_ret == DCMD_SUCCESS)
7527 doscan = SCAN_PD_CHANNEL;
7528 break;
7529
7530 case MR_EVT_LD_OFFLINE:
7531 case MR_EVT_CFG_CLEARED:
7532 case MR_EVT_LD_DELETED:
7533 case MR_EVT_LD_CREATED:
7534 if (!instance->requestorId ||
7535 (instance->requestorId && megasas_get_ld_vf_affiliation(instance, 0)))
7536 dcmd_ret = megasas_ld_list_query(instance, MR_LD_QUERY_TYPE_EXPOSED_TO_HOST);
7537
7538 if (dcmd_ret == DCMD_SUCCESS)
7539 doscan = SCAN_VD_CHANNEL;
7540
7541 break;
7542
7543 case MR_EVT_CTRL_HOST_BUS_SCAN_REQUESTED:
7544 case MR_EVT_FOREIGN_CFG_IMPORTED:
7545 case MR_EVT_LD_STATE_CHANGE:
7546 dcmd_ret = megasas_get_pd_list(instance);
7547
7548 if (dcmd_ret != DCMD_SUCCESS)
7549 break;
7550
7551 if (!instance->requestorId ||
7552 (instance->requestorId && megasas_get_ld_vf_affiliation(instance, 0)))
7553 dcmd_ret = megasas_ld_list_query(instance, MR_LD_QUERY_TYPE_EXPOSED_TO_HOST);
7554
7555 if (dcmd_ret != DCMD_SUCCESS)
7556 break;
7557
7558 doscan = SCAN_VD_CHANNEL | SCAN_PD_CHANNEL;
7559 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "scanning for scsi%d...\n",
7560 instance->host->host_no);
7561 break;
7562
7563 case MR_EVT_CTRL_PROP_CHANGED:
7564 dcmd_ret = megasas_get_ctrl_info(instance);
7565 break;
7566 default:
7567 doscan = 0;
7568 break;
7569 }
7570 } else {
7571 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "invalid evt_detail!\n");
7572 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
7573 kfree(ev);
7574 return;
7575 }
7576
7577 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
7578
7579 if (doscan & SCAN_PD_CHANNEL) {
7580 for (i = 0; i < MEGASAS_MAX_PD_CHANNELS; i++) {
7581 for (j = 0; j < MEGASAS_MAX_DEV_PER_CHANNEL; j++) {
7582 pd_index = i*MEGASAS_MAX_DEV_PER_CHANNEL + j;
7583 sdev1 = scsi_device_lookup(host, i, j, 0);
7584 if (instance->pd_list[pd_index].driveState ==
7585 MR_PD_STATE_SYSTEM) {
7586 if (!sdev1)
7587 scsi_add_device(host, i, j, 0);
7588 else
7589 scsi_device_put(sdev1);
7590 } else {
7591 if (sdev1)
7592 megasas_remove_scsi_device(sdev1);
7593 }
7594 }
7595 }
7596 }
7597
7598 if (doscan & SCAN_VD_CHANNEL) {
7599 for (i = 0; i < MEGASAS_MAX_LD_CHANNELS; i++) {
7600 for (j = 0; j < MEGASAS_MAX_DEV_PER_CHANNEL; j++) {
7601 ld_index = (i * MEGASAS_MAX_DEV_PER_CHANNEL) + j;
7602 sdev1 = scsi_device_lookup(host, MEGASAS_MAX_PD_CHANNELS + i, j, 0);
7603 if (instance->ld_ids[ld_index] != 0xff) {
7604 if (!sdev1)
7605 scsi_add_device(host, MEGASAS_MAX_PD_CHANNELS + i, j, 0);
7606 else
7607 scsi_device_put(sdev1);
7608 } else {
7609 if (sdev1)
7610 megasas_remove_scsi_device(sdev1);
7611 }
7612 }
7613 }
7614 }
7615
7616 if (dcmd_ret == DCMD_SUCCESS)
7617 seq_num = le32_to_cpu(instance->evt_detail->seq_num) + 1;
7618 else
7619 seq_num = instance->last_seq_num;
7620
7621 /* Register AEN with FW for latest sequence number plus 1 */
7622 class_locale.members.reserved = 0;
7623 class_locale.members.locale = MR_EVT_LOCALE_ALL;
7624 class_locale.members.class = MR_EVT_CLASS_DEBUG;
7625
7626 if (instance->aen_cmd != NULL) {
7627 kfree(ev);
7628 return;
7629 }
7630
7631 mutex_lock(&instance->reset_mutex);
7632 error = megasas_register_aen(instance, seq_num,
7633 class_locale.word);
7634 if (error)
7635 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
7636 "register aen failed error %x\n", error);
7637
7638 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
7639 kfree(ev);
7640}
7641
7642/**
7643 * megasas_init - Driver load entry point
7644 */
7645static int __init megasas_init(void)
7646{
7647 int rval;
7648
7649 /*
7650 * Booted in kdump kernel, minimize memory footprints by
7651 * disabling few features
7652 */
7653 if (reset_devices) {
7654 msix_vectors = 1;
7655 rdpq_enable = 0;
7656 dual_qdepth_disable = 1;
7657 }
7658
7659 /*
7660 * Announce driver version and other information
7661 */
7662 pr_info("megasas: %s\n", MEGASAS_VERSION);
7663
7664 spin_lock_init(&poll_aen_lock);
7665
7666 support_poll_for_event = 2;
7667 support_device_change = 1;
7668
7669 memset(&megasas_mgmt_info, 0, sizeof(megasas_mgmt_info));
7670
7671 /*
7672 * Register character device node
7673 */
7674 rval = register_chrdev(0, "megaraid_sas_ioctl", &megasas_mgmt_fops);
7675
7676 if (rval < 0) {
7677 printk(KERN_DEBUG "megasas: failed to open device node\n");
7678 return rval;
7679 }
7680
7681 megasas_mgmt_majorno = rval;
7682
7683 /*
7684 * Register ourselves as PCI hotplug module
7685 */
7686 rval = pci_register_driver(&megasas_pci_driver);
7687
7688 if (rval) {
7689 printk(KERN_DEBUG "megasas: PCI hotplug registration failed \n");
7690 goto err_pcidrv;
7691 }
7692
7693 rval = driver_create_file(&megasas_pci_driver.driver,
7694 &driver_attr_version);
7695 if (rval)
7696 goto err_dcf_attr_ver;
7697
7698 rval = driver_create_file(&megasas_pci_driver.driver,
7699 &driver_attr_release_date);
7700 if (rval)
7701 goto err_dcf_rel_date;
7702
7703 rval = driver_create_file(&megasas_pci_driver.driver,
7704 &driver_attr_support_poll_for_event);
7705 if (rval)
7706 goto err_dcf_support_poll_for_event;
7707
7708 rval = driver_create_file(&megasas_pci_driver.driver,
7709 &driver_attr_dbg_lvl);
7710 if (rval)
7711 goto err_dcf_dbg_lvl;
7712 rval = driver_create_file(&megasas_pci_driver.driver,
7713 &driver_attr_support_device_change);
7714 if (rval)
7715 goto err_dcf_support_device_change;
7716
7717 return rval;
7718
7719err_dcf_support_device_change:
7720 driver_remove_file(&megasas_pci_driver.driver,
7721 &driver_attr_dbg_lvl);
7722err_dcf_dbg_lvl:
7723 driver_remove_file(&megasas_pci_driver.driver,
7724 &driver_attr_support_poll_for_event);
7725err_dcf_support_poll_for_event:
7726 driver_remove_file(&megasas_pci_driver.driver,
7727 &driver_attr_release_date);
7728err_dcf_rel_date:
7729 driver_remove_file(&megasas_pci_driver.driver, &driver_attr_version);
7730err_dcf_attr_ver:
7731 pci_unregister_driver(&megasas_pci_driver);
7732err_pcidrv:
7733 unregister_chrdev(megasas_mgmt_majorno, "megaraid_sas_ioctl");
7734 return rval;
7735}
7736
7737/**
7738 * megasas_exit - Driver unload entry point
7739 */
7740static void __exit megasas_exit(void)
7741{
7742 driver_remove_file(&megasas_pci_driver.driver,
7743 &driver_attr_dbg_lvl);
7744 driver_remove_file(&megasas_pci_driver.driver,
7745 &driver_attr_support_poll_for_event);
7746 driver_remove_file(&megasas_pci_driver.driver,
7747 &driver_attr_support_device_change);
7748 driver_remove_file(&megasas_pci_driver.driver,
7749 &driver_attr_release_date);
7750 driver_remove_file(&megasas_pci_driver.driver, &driver_attr_version);
7751
7752 pci_unregister_driver(&megasas_pci_driver);
7753 unregister_chrdev(megasas_mgmt_majorno, "megaraid_sas_ioctl");
7754}
7755
7756module_init(megasas_init);
7757module_exit(megasas_exit);
7758
